As a first time visitor to Paris, I found the position perfect as most major attractions were within easy walking distance. The hotel was comfortable and the staff were very accommodating and helpful. I would definitely recommend Hotel Des Deux Continents for your Paris stay.
The room was a little bit small but I am told that is normal for Paris. Remember after all we are not here to stay in our room. Enjoy Paris !!!

Well located, nice ambience. Clean rooms and pleasant helpful staff.
Nothing

Great location, friendly staff, room was clean
Our room was quite small but based on research this is the norm for Paris and decently sized for Paris

I liked the location. Rooms were nice (I had to move to a different room).
The showers! Both were disastrous. In the second room, the stall was so tight I had to make sure I didn’t get hurt going in and out if it. Both showers were impossible to control, temperature wise. They would go from freezing to burning hot while being used. Dangerous and uncomfortable!

Breakfast was excellent.Staff friendly and helpful. Good air conditioning.

 Toilet had mold, should have been cleaner.

Location was wonderful. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was excellent.
Room was a little small, but it is Paris and close to many things.

Fabulous location and had a huge balcony on the top floor!

location and breakfast.
price.

Great location, nice breakfast, in a nice small, human size hotel.

It had a comfortable king size bed and was a good sized room by Paris standards and you pay a premium for it. It was a great location, close to the Louvre, and metro stations. Situated in Saint-Germain-des-Pres, this hotel is extremely convenient being walking distance from the Louvre and Champs Elysees. The staff are fantastic, helping with small requests and very polite. The small touches in the room such as a water bottle every day were much appreciated.

Location

Breakfast really good,balcony was a nice touch, room clean water replaced each day. Staff really friendly. Good location.

Location of the hotel was very good, Staff was pleasant and helpful

excellent location nice restaurants in area (lebanese!) little wine bar interesting shops walking distance from seine etc.

bathroom and toilet quite small....

Very cosy, relaxed place to stay, great location in the heart of Saint-Germain; lots of lovely cafes, bars & shops. The staff were friendly & service was great!

Room was perfect for my requirements a one night stay with breakfast. Guests are allowed to leave their luggage until check in time, and again leave their luggage after checking out until evening travel. Reception staff were helpful and arranged a taxi to the station. Breakfast was good with hot and cold dishes. Location was perfect, centre of Paris and interesting arty district.
Being English, I would have liked milk of some kind with the tea/coffee making facility in the room

The hotel is well situated, offering a good breakfast buffet. The room was cosy, but well appointed. I would certainly use it again.
I was content.

The place was great. It's located near the river, 7 min of walking from the Louvre. The room was clean and cozy. The staff was super friendly and welcoming. Very nice big windows with a romantic view on the street.

The location is in Paris centre near St. Germain de Pres church.

the location is good，and staff is kind and always keep smile.

Quality material is used everywhere in the room. The place is exactly how it looks like in the pictures. Greatest location. Excellent staff. Clean place.

full_description:
Situé à Paris, le Babel Belleville propose un salon commun, une terrasse, un restaurant et un bar. Il se trouve à environ 1,9 km de la gare de l'Est, à 3 km du centre Pompidou et à 3,1 km de la gare du Nord. Il propose une réception ouverte 24h/24, des transferts aéroport, un service d'étage et une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite dans l'ensemble de ses locaux.

L'hôtel sert un petit-déjeuner buffet.

Vous séjournerez à 3,8 km de la salle de concert La Cigale et de l'opéra Bastille. L'aéroport de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle est implanté à 18 km.
all_reviews_text:
Super petit hôtel qui vous fait vivre une vraie experience. Et tout le personnel est vraiment sympa ! Je recommande vivement !

Le personnel est accueillant et agréable. L'hôtel est très propre, la literie confortable et la décoration est fantastique. La chambre était petite mais bien pensée et aménagée. 
L'hôtel est vraiment très proche du métro Belleville donc très pratique pour se déplacer.
Par rapport au prix et pour avoir pu comparer avec d'autres hôtels parisiens, la qualité du petit déjeuner n'est pas à la hauteur. Peu de choix, les viennoiseries étaient de mauvaise qualité, pas de machine à café/boissons chaudes à disposition, le café semble être du café filtre servi dans un pichet isotherme.

Très bel hôtel décoré avec goût. L'accueil y est chaleureux. Belle ambiance au bar restaurant. 
Emplacement idéal, dans un quartier très vivant

Le confort des chambres, l’accueil et la gentillesse du personnel

L'accueil, l'ambiance détendue, le petit-déjeuner.

L accueil très sympathique
Rien

L'emplacement est top, tout est à proximité et quartier très vivant. La literie est de bonne qualité et la décoration change de ce que l'on trouve habituellement sur Paris
La proximité de la rue piétonne et des bars rendent les chambres du premier étage plutôt bruyante

Le cadre oriental moderne était très dépaysant et relaxant. La literie est d'une belle qualité pour un sommeil ressourçant. Le petit-déjeuner ainsi que le thé glacé marocain étaient succulents. On a cru voyagé au Maroc alors que l'on était à Paris !
Rien. Tout était parfait. Peut-être un peu glauque les récitals diffusés dans l'ascenseur mais ça nous a valu un fou rire donc c'est oublié.

L’ambiance, la décoration qui permettent de voyager et de se sentir ailleurs!
Des détails: l’absence de verre à dents et de lumière dans la salle de bain (pas facile de se maquiller dans la lumière tamisée) et de rangements dans la chambre. Les 4 cintres sont ok pour un we sans bagages mais comment font les touristes qui séjournent plus de deux nuits 🤔?

L’atmosphère et la décoration intérieure, très dépaysantes .
Rien

LOVELY BABEL! Avec ma fille, nous avons tout aimé!
Le quartier est idéal, à deux pas du métro Belleville, on a accédé à tous nos lieux de visite en 20 minutes en métro! 
L'hôtel est d'un raffinement incroyable, une décoration magnifique, un soin et une propreté impeccable. La chambre est parfaite, un lit douillet, une douche avec un tadelakt magnifique, les petits détails raffinés et simples. Un coup de coeur. Nous avons dormi au calme, un silence rare à Paris!
Le petit déjeuner est bien le meilleur qu'il m'est été donné de découvrir dans un hôtel. Le petit déjeuner est finement recherché, avec des détails subtils, d'une influence orientale divine, copieux à souhait, je ne peux qu'en faire l'éloge! La citronnade, le chaï sont absolument à goûter! 
Et l'équipe, un grand merci à tous pour votre accueil, votre gentillesse, c'est une joie d'avoir échangé avec vous, votre hôtel sera notre source quand nous reviendrons à Paris! A tout bientôt! Sourires depuis la Drôme! Nathalie et Louise

Le "concept", literie; originalité du décor; vraiment "babel". Toilettes séparées de la SDB. Petit déjeuner très bon et très original (avec viennoiseries quand même)
Le personnel, un peu froid au début, mais beaucoup plus détendu après. Peu de rangements pour les vêtements. Un peu cher pour un 2 étoiles si je ne m'abuse, c'est le seul "reproche".

Hotel atypique, beau, un voyage...
Chambre très confortable, cosy, une décoration incroyable, plein de petits détails (the et café servis dans de très jolis contenants, une bouilloire magnifique...)
Le personnel est top, très chaleureux et a l'écoute, petit dej et repas du midi juste parfait.
Un grand merci.

Tout d'abord l'hôtel est magnifique, tous les détails sont biens pensés et collent parfaitement avec le dépaysement souhaité. Pour ce qui est de la chambre, elle est spacieuse pour Paris, très belle, la literie est bonne et la salle de bain est agréable.

Une note particulière pour la nourriture, le petit déjeuner est excellent, tous les produits sont frais. Quand au brunch du dimanche matin, sa qualité est irréprochable tant sur le goût que sur la qualité des produits utilisés. Que ce soit pour un séjour dans cet hôtel ou hors de l'hôtel, je vous conseille ce brunch qui pour moi est tout simplement imbattable pour ce prix (28€).

Les personnels sont à l'image de l'établissement, jeune, bienveillants, souriants, souvent blagueurs et toujours à l'écoute de la moindre petite chose.

- L'atmosphère, la décoration, les petit détails et la cuisine ! Magnifique et très agréable. 
- Quartier très sympa
- Chambre vraiment agréable et bien décorée
- Il y avait des souris dans le restaurant et dans les murs de ma chambre. Réaction de la réception : c'est Paris ! Pas du tout, j'ai visité une vingtaine d'hôtels ce mois-ci et c'était le seul avec des souris. Je n'aime pas du tout cette façon de minimiser/déresponsabiliser l'hôtel. 
- Le personnel peu enthousiaste dans sa façon de répondre et d'accueillir les clients. Les membres de l'équipe parlent entre eux, critiquent leur travail et d'autres collègues absents, parlent de leur vie privé au téléphone juste devant l'entrée. Il manque un bureau dans cet hôtel et surtout il manque une séparation claire entre vie privé et vie pro.

La literie

Gorgeous aesthetic and modern touch to the hotel overall, rooms were well serviced with good cooling and heating options, excellent shower and bathroom and great proximity to the nearest train station ( less than 3 minute walk from the hotel)- and you’ll get into the city centre within 20 minutes. So many wonderful eating spots and restaurants nearby too, and a laundromat just around the corner ( about 1€ for washing powder and about 2-3€ for wash + dry) . So convenient.
Limited space in rooms however this is to be expected. We still felt like the room was very well designed and worked well with the space it had. 

Beds were not very comfortable, and were quite hard! Sorry!

Can highly recommend Babel for anyone looking for a simple, relaxing stay in Paris in beautiful surroundings. You can feel that the people behind Babel have cared for the details in making this a comfortable stay for everyone. The staff were very friendly and the rooms had everything we needed. We were pleasently surprised at how calm at quiet it was at night even when our room was facing the street. Lovely place!

Beautifully furnished, very clean and comfortable and a great location

Loved the decor, beds were comfortable, staff friendly
Area around it is run down and not much to do.. But luckily the metro is down the street

Beautiful hotel, very comfortable beds and perfectly sized rooms. In a great location really close to everything both walking distance and via the metro

Myself and my partner recently stayed at Babel Belleville, which was such a lovely side street hotel. Next to many cafes, bars, supermarkets and the metro within walking distance from the hotel. 

We didn’t eat at the hotel as we wanted to venture out into the centre of Paris so we could enjoy our experience even more. 

The room itself was very clean, comfortable, warm and spacious. 

We had a very good couple of nights sleep in this hotel and we’re grateful to have stayed with you. 

Would definitely recommend your hotel to anyone we know going to Paris.
Absolutely nothing.

Brilliant location in the 20th arr. easy to reach the station and central Paris. The 20th is a fantastic area of Paris to explore!
Comfortable, great location and a great atmosphere

Stylish and good location for the metro.
Nothing

Very close to metro station which meant we were connected to everything
Shower was broken for the first day of our two day trip, staff did their best to fix it but was inconvenient.

It was so Parisian . Very comfortable bed . Excellent breakfast and restaurant. Very quiet room . Warm friendly staff .
No complaints

The hotel's aesthetics and look were nice and created a great atmosphere for our holiday. The breakfast was really good even though the kitchen/restaurant had holiday. Simple but the quality and taste was amazing

The atmosphere and the staff were really nice!
I wish there was a fridge in the hotel room

location: however the hotel is located somewhat outside of the city center, because metro line 2 is literally around the corner all important sites to visit feel closeby.
Very clean and cosy hotel with all amenities and information, ... available.
Very friendly staff, who is available 24/7. 
The rooms are somewhat small, but this didn't bother us or we didn't see this as negative. Everything you need is available, and in a city such as Paris you only are in the room to sleep/rest and shower.
Everything was great. 
as mentioned above, the room was to smaller size, but this didn't bother us since everything was very clean and everything you need is available.

Great staff. Clean rooms, nice atmosphere. Facilities and hotel generally if a high standard. The room was a little small but that comes with a city hotel the restaurant and bar is very nice, romantic. But a top, top boutique hotel but a high quality one.
Room was a little small. Toilet small.

Room, amenities , very friendly and professional staff , great atmosphere and great location
Breakfast layout is a bit confusing and could be replenished a bit quicker

Belleville rocks!

Rooms are updated and air conditioned, and all the staff were so friendly to us. Would definitely recommend!

Breakfast could be better ☺️

Good location. Excellent attention to the physical details of the stay. 
Good breakfast provided.
Delicious food at the restaurant during the day. 
Professional, friendly & helpful staff; welcoming ambience and satisfying attention to the aesthetic. 
I’m definitely coming back.

Friendly staff
Location was amazing
No fruits at breakfast but breakfast was amazing.

We really loved this hotel. It was in a young and lively area of the city, but felt more local than touristy. We didn’t manage to try the hotel restaurant as it wasn’t open on a Sunday when we were staying local, but we ended up in the restaurant just on the corner, Le Grand Bain, which was amazing. The bar opposite was also great, amazing wines and lovely staff. The hotel itself was great, the room was gorgeous, really original we loved the decor, and the bed was really comfy. The hotel bar was great, and all the staff were lovely, the breakfast was good too. It’s also only a minute’s walk to the Metro, with shops nearby, and only 15 minutes or so to the centre of Paris.
Nothing really! It wasn’t as central as some of the more touristy areas, but we really liked Belville, the area, and we would definitely stay here again.

We loved our stay at Babel Belleville. The location was great, the room was lovely and comfy, and we loved that there was no tv but radio/music was the focus of the room! We would definitely stay here again!

Really stylish hotel. Beautifully designed rooms and decor. Vintage Moroccan vibe. Very cool. Plus good location near to lots of wonderful restaurants.
Breakfast was okay. Coffee was always in short supply and not replenished. Pastries were plentiful, but eggs were cold and also not replenished.

Lovely decor and individual style
Not much room to put clothes

Cozy room, friendly staff and great breakfast

Great vibe, great outside seating, great atmosphere. All the staff were awesome, friendly, helpful.

Everything! We’ve been to Paris so many times and staying in Belleville, and particularly this hotel, made us fall in love with it even more.
Nothing!

The hotel was very clean and well kept with good attention to sustainability! Very friendly staff and overall it was such a good vibe!

The staff was friendly and attentive. Beautiful decor and a nice breakfast. The air-conditioned rooms are clean and small but average (in size) for the city with comfortable beds. The complimentary water, coffee, and delights are a thoughtful and appreciated touch. Taking the stairs isn't a problem for us but there is also a lift.
Small rooms, but this is normal for the city. The location leaves room for desire, it is very close to the metro but the area has rough edges.

Really great theme, good in hotel restaurant amazing, clean and a great location for metro and for walking if you like a good walk.
Need to replenish the toilet roll. Panic stations on last day 😀

Everything!
Nothing!

It is beautifully decorated and the tea and coffee and kettle in the room were a great touch. The staff were lovely to talk to and breakfast was amazing! They even let me take some breakfast away on the go as I had to leave very early Saturday morning.
I don’t like n open shower. Water got everywhere. My room also faced the side street so it was a little noisy but I had earplugs so could get some sleep.

Really liked the style of this place with all its little flourishes. The hotel was located in a convenient location for us, very close to a Metro station and with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. The breakfast was a bit limited but we did enjoy having something a bit different to a traditional hotel breakfast. The bed was comfortable and the shower was good. Would be happy to stay here again!
This is probably the case all over Paris but the rooms were very small. I knew this before we visited and didn’t expect it to be a problem, and it wasn’t a big problem, but I couldn’t help but feel a bit claustrophobic. Also, the coffee set was not cleaned each time the room was made up. Again, not a big problem, but just thought that was odd

We loved it all. The location, the design aesthetic, the value. Staff was welcoming, the cafe was charming to sit outside and have coffee in the morning. The room was small but met our needs perfectly and had thoughtful, design-y touches. The bathroom products smelled divine.

Great location, just a very short walk from the metro. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The style of the hotel was just beautiful. I loved my room so much.
Yes, it is small but as long as you are travelling light it isn't a problem.

Beautiful hotel in a nice quiet street

Very nice cosy hotel, small rooms but comfortable, nice lounge / restaurant area and friendly staff
Small rooms and location is ok

Look and feel, very good wine list for a hotel bar
Staff quite nonchalant / aimiable among colleagues. Also I understand not 7/7 dinner service but at least one member of staff running the bar is required I’d say. On Sunday we were given the coffee bill at 4pm

Beautiful decor, very clean and comfortable.
Breakfast choices were a little limited.

Third time at Babel and it gets better every time
 Such good value and a great spot.
Nothing, all awesome

Beautifully designed, nothing average about the design and everything was thought about carefully. The staff couldn’t do enough to take care of us.
Nothing

Staff are fantastic
Breakfast could use some small tweaks

Great location, the rooms are very stylish with nice touches, like real coffee and a delicately flavoured (green) loose tea and Turkish delight as a 'amuse bouche'.
Well, the shower head was dripping...but otherwise I loved the room. Might be a push for two people as quite small.

This hotel is so special, the staff the food the decorations the vibes….. 10/10

We liked the decor and comfort
The location felt a little unsafe. A tv in the room would have been lovely

Great decor very comfortable
Didn't have a cafitiere in the room for coffee.

Lovely room - much bigger than I thought it would be and in a really great location. 2 mins walk away from metro and loads of good bars and restaurants near by.
We had a leaking shower which they warned us about on arrival which was annoying when trying to sleep but the complementary earplugs sorted that out.

Design, soft bed
Was anough cold in a room

Location and staff. Comfortable bed.
Weird colonial decor, price felt steep

Staff were very welcoming and attentive, room was perfect clean and well designed with nice details. Overall hotel is very comforting place. Loved the area as well as the Babel restaurant there are also great restaurants and bars around. Would definitely stay again
Hate to say it but I did miss a TV in the room! Also breakfast layout was a bit small and awkward to navigate - could do with extra table or space to rest plate when self serving. A small explanation of offer or extra options would have been nice and location of breakfast offer is in centre of space so everyone watches you struggle!

Babel is such a cool hotel, with a Middle Eastern vibe decor and cuisine. I really love the vibe, the friendly staff, the cocktails and the neighbourhood of Belleville
Everything was really good. The only thing that was missing were some amenities in the room, like a safety deposit box, minibar and a place to hang a long coat / dress. This would make the room just a bit more comfortable. Keep in mind that if you travel with friends and share a room, the bathroom has a glass door.

Botique, african influence. Beutiful hotel and friendl staff. Great spot for a moody cocktail in the evening. Feels like a hidden gem staying there!

The hotel was very charming and the restaurant downstairs had delicious food. The staff were very helpful. The location is lovely in an alley with cafes and it does not feel too touristy there. It is also right next to the metro. The bed was comfortable, and the service from staff was exceptional.
The room was quite small, and when the window is open, there is a lever that tends to stick out. It is easy to bump into it because the bed is so close, and I got bruises on my leg from that. It would be nice to have a window without that lever if the room is so small.

Cool decor. Quiet, stylish, and comfortable room. Good bed and shower, used the small space well. Really liked the overall vibe. Considerate and welcoming staff too.
Breakfast was fine, but some little touches were lacking (coffee pots empty, syrup and milk missing, no clean mugs), and would have preferred my coffee stronger! Very little things there…

loved this place - great vibe, fun atmosphere, staff is helpful and super cool, definitely return
would love a minifridge in the room so i can store all the yummy things i love to buy in paris but that was the only thing i felt was missing and not even a necessity

Classy, Great staff, lovely bar and restaurant, food / mezze was to die for, good coffee, great cocktails, well decorated, well lit, rooms are small but decorated brilliantly, shower is great, rooms really fantastic and in Paris, most hotel rooms are generally small anyway, but couldn’t fault it, at all, I will stay there next time 100%
nothing

The decor, the atmosphere, the staff,

Fantastic location, and price. Right next to the metro station (line 11 and 4) that gets you straight into the main areas of Paris within 10-15 mins.

Quiet backstreet, and very well decorated hotel. 

Later 12pm checkout as standard was nice after a few busy days in Paris seeing the sights. 

The bar area, and staff were fantastic, very pleased with our stay and would return again!
N/A

Location was great gave us a real insight into Parisian life. Staff were amazing, hotel was chilled and well looked after.
Nothing

The staff at this hotel may be the friendliest and most helpful that we have ever met. They went out of their way to help us. The location was ideal as it was just off of a boulevard and 50 yards from the Belleville Metro. There were numerous restaurants of all types within short walking distance and it was very easy to access all of the major sites of Paris. The breakfast was excellent even though it was the same each day. We can't say enough about how wonderful the staff is. The bar/restaurant was a real active/fun spot.
The room was a little small if a traveler has much luggage and the breakfast was the same each day, even though it was very great.

I appreciated the positive attitude and the service of the personnel; they were all very welcoming. The room was cosy and had a unique character. Attention to detail was obvious everywhere. The restaurant served delicious dishes.
The rooms are quite small (as everywhere in Paris) and the portions of the dishes were on the small side as well. Or could it be that they were so delicious that I wanted more?

What a pleasure to stay at Babel - we did not want to leave! 

The staff were just fantastic and the food (we tried both breakfast and dinner), the beautiful decor, hospitality and ambiance was just superb. Nothing was too much to ask; from ice, to chargers to taxis to extra pillows, the team went above and beyond for us and always with such friendly service. 

A true Parisien experience in an exciting and vibrant neighbourhood - highly recommended. 

Thanks again guys - merci and with love from Afrique du Sud ❤️

Staff was friendly, room was very clean and comfortable would recommend to anyone

Location amazing and very cool.
Coffee at breakfast could have been better, but that really didn't matter

Very unique style of the hotel, great attention to detail. Great Location, easy to access from Gare Du Nord and visit all main attractions in Paris. Hotel provided a great breakfast selection.
rooms could have racks for the suitcases rather than just laying stuff on the floor. There were only few hangers for clothes and no hooks for coats/smaller bags.

The breakfast was excellent, rooms stylish and neighbourhood lively.
The rooms were small - but that is to be expected in Paris.

Tucked away in a quiet pedestrian street in the residential neighbourhood of Belleville is this little hotel full of character and charm. Babel is full of surprises to say the least! 
Mum and I checked in late afternoon so we decided to have dinner downstairs in the restaurant instead of going out anywhere that night, we sat in the quirky little restaurant to find that all within the next 30 minutes or so it was full to the brim. Our dinner was served and I must say it was absolutely Divine! We were gobsmacked by just how good it was 
The hotel has a Moroccan vibe and the restaurant too, the bed is like sleeping on a cloud, the staff incredibly friendly and the style is an eclectic mix of found objects, cool artwork and personal touches that add to the homely vibe. 
Super cute, super comfortable. The metro is a 2 minute walk from the hotel, so convenient. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay, I was sad to leave.
The foyer / cafe floor could really do with a good clean, it's the first thing I noticed as I walked in. The neighbourhood and surrounding back streets are littered with graffiti and a bit dodgy looking, but we never felt unsafe walking to the hotel at night. On first impressions I wouldn't let this deter you as the hotel itself is charming.

On the outskirts of central paris, but in a very friendly and lively area, and super close to metro station. Incredibly nice customer service from everyone. Very cosy and comfortable rooms, super quiet since no rooms on street. Great breakfast in a large patio.

The room, staff, breakfast, and location were all incredible.

I loved the interior design of the hotel. It felt really special compared to other touristy hotels. Breakfast was available each morning, and when we were able to enjoy it, it was delicious. The location is right next to the metro, so even though it's not super close to most tourist attractions, it was very easy to get around. The bed was extremely comfortable and the hotel was peacefully quiet.
The rooms were quite small which I expected in Europe, but it would have been nice to have a few extra hooks to hang our coats, towels and other items on. I would have loved a shelf or two in the shower as well for all our toiletries.

Lovely staff, beautiful atmosphere and decor. We loved the common areas for breakfast and a drink in the evening. The bedroom decor was also very beautiful, small but very lovely and super comfy beds.
We had no room to unpack clothes for 3/4 days it was a little small for us just to have 4 hangers in an open shelf and in future stays we'd probably need to stay in a room that had more clothes storage space to be more comfortable but for 2 nights, it's fine and a lovely comfortable room if you don't need to unpack a case.

The location, the ambience, the staff. The breakfast was fantastic.
A television, although it forced me to read more :-)

(1) Extremely comfortable bed
(2) Very clean
(3) Location ideal
(4) Some thought had gone into the design and artistry of the hotel
(5) Some nice touches in bedroom eg real coffee and pastries
(1) Basin IN bedroom and very close to the bed
(2) Shower door transparent and very close to the head of the bed
…People like privacy!!! 
(3) Breakfast disappointing (we went elsewhere after the first morning)

The breakfast , decor , the staff was very helpful and assorted me with an emergency dentist appointment and many other fun day trip bookings

All very friendly and hotel well situated for getting around. Right next to metro
All fine

Staff was very helpful
Pretty small space but We managed

The room was bigger than expected, clean and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a great place to say for a city break!
There could have been a few more options at breakfast and some additional amenities in the room.

The staff is super cool. The interior is very beautiful. Everything is very clean. Nice place to spend some more time - maybe dinner or wine in the evening.
Delicious breakfast, although not for people on a diet trying to loose weight, but then again - who goes to Paris to loose weight 🤪 metro stop is around the corner, so it’s quite convenient. I highly recommend 👏

Great location, easy to get to from the Eurostar, with many restaurants, bars and cafes close by. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the beds are comfy and the tea leaves, coffee plunger and homemade biscuits in the room are a lovely touch.

Lovely, quirky place - fantastic atmosphere. Small touches in the rooms were lovely, very comfortable bed. Young enthusiastic staff and great music in the restaurant. Very mixed neighbourhood, with little shops and small businesses, easy walking distance to Place La Republic and very close to transport. Great spot.

The atmosphere and the smell of the hotel was very pleasant.
The room was very small.

Babel was like a little oasis in Paris, the hotel is super charming, the staff are very helpful and polite and the room, although small, is very comfortable! The bed makes you feel like you’re sleeping in the clouds and the decoration is incredible, everything thought out to the smallest details to have an artsy touch, which is the highlight of staying in Belleville. The neighborhood is absolutely beautiful, with several open-air galleries, many restaurants and cafes that have a touch of Paris that goes beyond the obvious. We hope to come back very soon!
Everything was perfect

Everything was perfect !!! The staff was very kind ! Bar man was kind and helpful! Even the soap and body lotion was amazing ! Congratulations
Everything was perfect, maybe the breakfast could have more options ! But its ok

great staff, great restaurant, cool hotel
Price very high and location a bit on the outskirts, but center very easy to reach by metro

The hotel is lovely and special. The food from the restaurant is absolutely delicious. The location is only a few metro stops from all the popular neighborhoods and sites. But most importantly the staff were so warm and welcoming. Taking the best care of me during my entire stay. I can't wait to go back.

Can’t recommend this hotel enough - great location in a busy and vibrant area yet not noisy at night (we had a room at the back of the hotel). The rooms are compact but really well designed from both a functional and aesthetic perspective - lots of attention to details that really make you feel at home. Like many others, we loved the music in the bar and enjoyed a delicious cocktail there before heading out to dinner.
Nothing we disliked

Staff was fantastic and incredibly helpful. The hotel is beautiful and designed with great attention to detail. Will 100% return next year.
Breakfast was delicious but maybe a bit more diversity and variety of choices. Prices for apparel and souvenirs.. If you could call it that are a bit excessive but then again nobody is forcing you to get them. There's no fridge and it would be great to have one but It seems like this is common in 3 even 4 stars hotels in Paris (not sure why🤷)

The decor was great. Lovely and clean. Nice vibe. Close to the metro. Food was good.
Rooms are a bit small but I think this is normal in Paris.

The atmosphere in the hotel was very pleasant, and the rooms are beautifully decorated. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Close to the subway, friendly staff, unique decor I could go on and on…. You name it they had it.
My husband didn’t like the hangers lol…

A real gem. Unique middle eastern theme offering great value, location and value. Situated in the buzzy Belleville area of the 20th arr. Not a real tourist area which made it all the better. Buzzy bars, local restaurants and a busy asian food quarter.
Breakfast is a limited continental style but nice all the same.

the style/architecture- very well accurate in all details - breakfast excellent simple but all you need 
: coffee, croissant bred jam yogurt super fresh orange juice - i asked for early check in they said 12 - I arrived at 10 AM and got immediately the room- brilliant
room little bit tiny -however for Paris standard is reasonable

Babel is an unusual hotel. It is decorated in a North African way, which is absolutely charming. The lift recites poetry relating to the Tower of Babel when going up and down. The room is spotless with nice decorations. Breakfast is excellent, detox juice, ghia pudding. Staff very friendly. Excellent location in very multicultural Belleville.
The room is not very practical. Nowhere to put your cases, hang your clothes or towels. We had to move the lovely decorations and coffee and tea facilities to the corner of a high shelf to make room for personal belongings. The trendy shower taps were stiff and it took us a while to work them out.

The property was thoughtfully decorated, clean, near local bars and restaurants, and right near a metro station

I love the authentic atmosphere of the hotel! You can feel Paris mood in every small detail. Room is tiny but very cozy. Near by the hotel there is a metro station so you can easily reach any place in Paris! We enjoyed a lot, I would recommend this hotel.

I'm absolutely in love with this hotel! Such a pleasant stay, amazing breakfast!!! Design is impeccable. Tea pot, variety of tea and coffee inside the room. No shampoo and conditioner tho, but otherwise nice soap, clean room and pleasant smell around. Location is close to Saint Martin, Le Marais. Very hype and cool.

Everything was fabulous! The bedroom, the furniture, the bathroom, the teas in the room, the dedsign, the open roof, the place, the restaurant!! The position, the staff, the breakfast was a sexy experience to make... I loved everything!

I didn['t have the breakfast.

Very cool place. Such friendly, welcoming staff, beautiful interior design and fab food and cocktails. Shakshuka and fresh juice at breakfast were both delicious.
There wasn't much not to like. It's a great hotel. My only grumble was that the room was tiny and not well designed for storing luggage or hanging clothes. This is more of a one night stay kind of place. But the do look beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. Other rooms might be larger.

Great location. Amazing decor. Great bed and nice and clean

This place was fabulous all around, great location, nice staff, good coffee.

Babel Bellville was wonderful.

Location was superb ( right next to Bellville station - easy train ride to everywhere in Paris ) - it's about a 20 minute train ride to the Louvre / half hour to Eiffel Tower

Staff was so kind & sweet : went out of their way to accommodate ( i.e. room amenities, coffee, etc.)

Room itself was nice size for Euro standards and very modern ( only oddity was lack of TV - which was fine because our goal was to see Paris rather then watch TV )

Breakfast was awesome - delicious variety of traditional French breakfast 


Helpful Tip : 

* Confirm what is included in hotel breakfast ( somethings maybe additional charge )
* Room's lack of TV ( though turned out to be a plus - started date earlier )

Very clean and stylish, great location, most stuffs are very nice. They have a nice bar downstairs.
The WiFi was broken for hours the first day I stayed. One of the stuff, the bold guy is really rude to me when serving breakfast!!!

Design, mattress quality

Well located and easy to check in. Room had a lovely view and was comfortable, clean and quiet
The included breakfast. Was very average - stale pastries, bad coffee and service was slow and inattentive

We have enjoyed our stay at Babel so much. The room is really pretty, big and comfortable bed and all the amenities are well thought. Keep in mind that there isn't a fridge in the room so you can't storage food that way. The air conditioning was working perfectly and we really liked the vibe of the entire place.
We have been a bit disappointed in the way breakfast was, as in you have a few things included in the price you pay for the accomodation (1 croissant/person, a little bit of butter and jam, some bread and you get to choose between chia with granola, yoghurt with fruits and some other thing). If you are a fan of a breakfast that includes eggs and bacon and other stuff like that, you can have them but you have to pay separately for them. Maybe, as an unsolicited advice for them, provide for breakfast the classic options people are used to combined with french specialties to give it a flare :)

Lovely, clean, friendly staff. Felt unique & chic.

Close to the underground.
Bar wasn’t open on a Monday evening.

Stylish, comfortable and charming

Staff were exceptional! Very stylish hotel

Staff were amazing and breakfast was quite good also. Loved the decor... So much attention to detail.
We were a bit disappointed that the restaurant/bar was closed while we were there but we understand that this is common in August in Paris.

It’s confortable

Mood, atmosphere, people, style, breakfast, music. 
A really special hotel!
Nothing.

The hotel is in a great location super close to the metro so really easy to get around. Loved the decor and general mood of the place, very cozy and warm! The Breakfast was charming and straightforward, would set you up for the morning - a selection of fresh juices and all presented on cute ceramics, I enjoyed the atmosphere very much. Option for dinner if you want to eat in, would definitely recommend at least eating in once. Staff was super helpful and nice.
I would have liked for the breakfast to change a little, maybe in terms of different pastries or options. Would have really liked a small fridge in the room. But overall really happy with everything.

Everything was clean and well decorated, also the bed was super comfortable!

Very friendly and helpful staff, beautiful design and great location next to the metro station! The restaurant bar with terrace is also really nice. the desserts were amazing. definitely recommend if you want to explore Paris from a less touristic, but more local area close to
the touristic city centre.

Love the ambience and styling of the rooms and hotel.
Great staff.
Location, a little too far from the centre.

Friendly staff, nice vibes, cute aesthetics, nice to grab a drink on the terrace. Good food.
mold in the shower and no cold water in the room’s sink

Friendly and accommodating staff. The bathroom and shower were really large for Paris, the room was comfortable, the little cookies in the room when we arrived were super cute! The only thing I wish was that we had more time to check out the restaurant.
We love walking around Paris so we did a lot of meeting people closer to the seine by walking 45 mins to an hour or so - if you want to be right in the heart of things then this might not be for you. On the other hand there are tons of cafes and restaurants closer by and the little cobblestone block where you enter is really sweet.

Everything was excellent
Nothing

Friendly staff, comfortable rooms. Loved the French style breakfast with optional extras (Extra cost). Unlimited coffee :)
Several of the plug sockets didn’t work in the room

Very clean, extremely comfortsble bed, nice shower etc
Perhaps lack of TV (but not essential) and poor breakfast - in particular the croissants.

Nice location close to subway. Everything clean and reception staff very nice and helpful.

I loved the location. was easy to navigate around Paris. I loved the people. they made my stay so special. they were always willing to help.
there wasn’t anything I didn’t like.

So close to a Metro station and just off a main boulevard. This is a secret slice of heaven. Very tasteful decor and the restaurant below is sublime. Fabulous staff.
Nothing.

I booked the Babel Belleville for me and my friends and they whopped when they saw the room! The decor, the special touches, OMG. The breakfast they offered wonderful immune boasting juices. Our dinner was one of the best we had in Europe! We are all artists who did a 3 week tour from Paris to Prague, with stops in between. Bellville with an alley down the block delighted us. Wish I booked more than one night.
Can't think of one thing!

The layout and decor
Nothing

The property was amazing, a perfect amalgamation of Moroccan and West Indian influence. The entire design is implacable. We stayed at a very expensive hotel before this and I actually preferred Babel. It oozes character and the staff were amazing. The breakfast was also delicious. Perfect for a couple visiting Paris.

The hotel was lovely and quirky. The food was amazing in the hotel, highly recommend eating there. the staff were nice and friendly.
The rooms are quite small, we did request a double bed as it was a mother and daughter trip but we’re given a double bed to share. the shower temperature was quite cold as well.

the location was perfect, just outside central
Paris in a vibrant neighborhood. the staff were exceptional!
cannot think of any negatives

I liked the vibe and decor

We were more than satisfied with our room and its state, the room service and especially the breakfast options. All staff were very friendly and accomodating, good athmosphere. Great place to come back to at the end of the day, hopefully we'll have reason to stay at Babel another time!

Babel is this cute getaway hotel that has this amazing breakfast with freshly squeezed orange juice or detox juice. We loved their Chia seed pudding and freshly baked croissants .
We had one of the biggest rooms but we were struggling to keep our suitcases open. I guess European hotels are comparatively smaller than US hotels

perfect location next to the metro
verrryyy comfortable bed
nice vibe and decoration
great breakfast
original cocktails 
feels lively all day
the team at breakfast seems a bit overwhelmed

good vibe
no tv in room

The room was nice and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious.
The district is really dodgy, I would never recommend staying there if you travel alone as a female or a gruop of female friends. I went out alone to get some water from the supermarket around the corner at around 9pm and was attacked by a black guy trying to get something from me. Fortunatelly, a busy bar was just a few meters away so I rushed there and he didn't chase. the district seemed dangerous from the first moment we stepped out of the metro and I would never stay there again. Also, the breakfast that's included in the price is quite small, only a croissant, a little dessert and some bread. All the extras such as eggs or cheese are not included and you have to pay extra for each, which was in a way unpleasant and unexpected. Perhaps it's just a Parisian thing, that they will always charge you for everything, but early chack-in was also priced at 20€ for after 12pm and 40€ for earlier than that. Which the receptionist didn't mention in our chat earlier when I asked for it.

Lovely hotel with very nice staff. Rooms are comfy and clean. Breakfast was good. Located in a more residential area and not so touristy. Easy to reach any part of Paris from there. The tube was just 100 m away.

Location fantastic. Room larger than I was expecting.
Cigarette smoke from the street coming up into the window.

this is a very special hotel

i will recommend.

Good water pressure in shower and close location to metro. I was able to leave my luggage at the hotel prior to the check-in time.

Awesome interior, friendly people, excellent accessibility by metro. Cozy & hygienic rooms.

Really cool hotel!

The property is unique and beautiful! We had lunch there and it was healthy and delicious! The staff is amazing and very accommodating! I will definitely return again
Rooms are a bit small. The Belleville metro is very close but there’s no escalator or elevator at the metro exit, so slightly difficult carrying our luggage. But this is not reflective on the hotel. The hotel is very nice.

The food was amazing. Loved the atmosphere at the restaurant in the evenings. The food was very fresh, simple, delicious.

stylish hotel. very close to metro. wifi works very well and shower works great
there were many electric sockets but not all of them works. especially the one where electric kettle is! Asked reception on the first evening. we stayed 4 nights and nothing happened. Drinking glasses in the room were not being clean everyday. One day the bed was not made!

Location was very good ! Metrostation Belleville around the corner, supermarket also (if you are in need of something) - Staff very friendly, hotelroom very cozy. good shower and toilet. hotelroom pretty small though and no tv (for us no problem, we don’t watch tv)
One minus, the little sink to wash your face, hands or brush your teeth. It was too small, everything around it got wet.

it was very quirky and very clean, the staff where very helpful and pleasant.
it was a bit far away from the centre but we managed to work out the metro so wasn’t that bad.

Love the room, the style and the sent
Rooms are a bit chilly and lighting in the shower a bit when you travel with someone. Hard to sleep if someone showers.

Liked the

Artsy room

nice hotel near metro stop. clean, friendly.

Liked that our two rooms were interconnected but also separated by a little corridor.
Only that the location felt a bit grungy. But that’s exactly why it’s a bit more affordable, and it was very easy to access everywhere by metro.

wonderful decor, the rooms were relaxing - simple yet have an element of luxury which is great for a stay in Paris! lovely staff and restaurant food was delicious.
nothing really. Clean and cosy room, pleasant interrior.
Helpful and friendly staff

lovely clean rooms and very friendly staff

exactly like the pics and staff very polite

Wow. This place is like a very thoughtfully decorated and comfortable alternative universe--an oasis. From the quality of the restaurant and bar products, to the music played, to the decor choices, and the staff, it's just superb overall. A very unique place in all the best ways.
Not much to say here, as this was a very satisfying stay.

Hotel with good interior in good location
Breakfast is only coffee with croissant and one dessert. Meals like eggs or similar are with extra charge

Very clean and well decorated. The location was perfect for experiencing a less traveled part of Paris for tourists.
Rooms were a tiny bit small but nothing we couldn’t adapt to.

Great decor and atmosphere. Very friendly and unpretentious. Helpful and nice staff.
Rooms were a tad tiny but appropriately reflects price point.

The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and nice.
I didn’t like the space of the room, it was a bit too small for 2 people. We didn’t have where to put our things, basically we left them in the luggage.

very cozy space and a nice feel. super nice staff and easy check in and out.
missing a bit of storage space for personal items at the room. and the room I was in was troubled with notices from the elevator and other guest yelling goodnight getting off the elevator throughout the night.

super affordable for the standard and vibe of boutique hotel
nothing

staff were very helpful and always happy. they were able to help with a medical problem and advise nearest pharmacy.
Room and hotel was just as pictures show … pretty boutique. Bed was really comfy and peaceful at night for a good sleep.
Nothing

The front desk staff (a very tall and black guy, forgot to ask his name) was super helpful and friendly. Gave me directions to supermarket and pharmacy. The breakfast was not too good, you have to pay £6-8 to get egg. Location was fine, close to metro, but in general it was not too close to many tourist attractions.

I loved the hotel! Nice vibe, friendly and helpful stuff, comfortable room and beautiful breakfast!!! Would definitely recommend it!!
A bit far from the city center if on foot, but is just 20m from the metro station and the connection is very good.

The staff and aesthetics.

the location and the staff
the room was too small for a luggage rack - nowhere to put our luggage and get in / out of it comfortably

Stylish and original decor and well equipped comfortable rooms, there was even a blue tooth speaker. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
The bathroom was a little small, location was a little way from the centre of town but right next to a Metro stop.

great location very close to Bellville metro

Fabulous location, close to metro and lots of restaurants. Staff spoke English and were so helpful. Really appreciated the tea and coffee making facilities in the room
Room a little small but very comfortable

Friendly staff. Good location close to the Metro. Well maintained with nice North African decor.
Limited cupboard and hanging space in the room. Pillows a bit small.

Warm and welcoming staff, really friendly and helpful. Beautifully decorated hotel and great food. Highly recommend!
Nothing!

the most incredibly friendly staff. super clean and very new facilities. interesting neighborhood and wonderful diversity of shops and open air market. not even a two minute walk to the metro station to explore all of Paris.
nothing.

Amazing hotel in a really edgy and interesting part of town. Right next door to the Metro which takes you everywhere and some great restaurants and bars close by. The staff were all incredibly friendly and so was the cat who will join you for breakfast. We will definitely come back.
Nothing

The lovely location, gorgeous room, fabulous showers and great staff.
Nothing I can think of!

The staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the style of the rooms. Breakfast was served in charming millieu of the hotel restaurant. We would like to stay here again, when in Paris.

The lobby smells amazing, the staff are lovely, the location is super close to the metro, and it has a great vibe. They do turn down your room each day while you are away which has become a rare amenity since Covid hit. We really enjoyed the chia pudding at breakfast. The room was good sized by Parisian standards (hotel rooms here are microscopic). I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next trip to Paris!
There is a cute cat who hangs out in the breakfast area sometimes. If you are severely allergic that is just something to be aware of.

Friendly staff, good location, comfortable stay

The staff were exceptional! So friendly and always ready to help with anything we needed. Breakfast was lovely, the croissants were very tasty, and the tea was great. It is right around the corner from the metro station. The decor in the hotel is beautiful, especially in the dining area.
I only had a couple of issues, both of which aren't really a big deal. The shower door was transparent and opposite to the bed, probably fine for couples, but not great for friends/family members. The coffee was also not to my taste personally, but of course, this is just personal preference.

Clean and modern room. Staff very pleasant. No noise at night. Close to metro.

lovely design, great food, super close to the metro & very friendly staff
nothing!

good shower, good air conditioning, good location close to the metro , nice breakfast.
Good restaurant recommendations and nice food in the hotel.
not enough hanging space but we managed

Good location, very clean and the hotel had a really lovely aesthetic.
Small room (although we knew this when booking the property), overall great stay!

The decor was great, nice use of space in the rooms. Restaurant/bar onsite is great. Location was good, very close to the Metro, very interesting neighbourhood, good restaurants in the area.
Beds were a tad bit small

Great location and loved the area. Family room was prefect as it's split into two so you don't have to sit in the dark! Restaurant closed as we were there on a Monday so disappointed not to eat there but highly recommended.

Beautiful room and decor
Very clean and well maintained 
Staff on the front desk were lovely
Excellent location, such a great neighborhood and around the corner from the Metro
Would have appreciated some milk in the room for coffee and a safe.
House-keeping walked into our room unannounced one morning whilst my partner was still sleeping - not very professional

full_description:
Ce bâtiment du XVIIIe siècle est situé dans le centre de Paris, à 20 minutes à pied de la Seine et du Louvre. Il propose des chambres élégantes et climatisées avec télévision à écran plat.

Toutes les chambres insonorisées sont dotées d'une salle de bains privative. Certaines disposent également d'une terrasse privée.

Sirotez un verre en soirée dans le bar de l'hôtel Le Saint Gregoire et dégustez un petit déjeuner continental tous les jours en matinée. La réception de l'hôtel est ouverte 24 heures sur 24 et la connexion Wi-Fi est disponible.

L'hôtel Le Saint Gregoire est situé à quelques pas de la station de métro Saint-Placide et à 5 minutes à pied de Montparnasse. Le Jardin du Luxembourg est à 500 mètres.

L'hôtel est très bien placé et la literie confortable. Les thés sont bons et les produits d'hygiène aussi. Personnel adorable.
Il faisait extrêmement chaud dans la chambre. Les chambres ne sont pas toujours bien insonorisées. La salle du petit-déjeuner est en sous-sol mais il y a l'option de prendre le petit-déjeuner dans sa chambre.

Le petit-déjeuner était très bon et la "salle" pourvue d'une jolie décoration. Le "patio" couvert de verdure. La chambre était très élégante et sa superficie suffisante pour un séjour de trois jours. Le calme de la rue dans un quartier fort animé. La station de métro appartenant à la ligne 4 qui mène directement à la Gare du Nord (= très important).
Peut-être - malgré ma remarque précédente - une superficie un peu plus grande (par exemple pour un séjour d'une semaine) serait un avantage.

L´accueil chaleureux et attentif, toujours à l´écoute. La chambre (12) était spacieuse, soigneusement decorée dans l´ambiance parisienne. La literie propre et impeccable avec un très grand lit. Coffre-fort personnel. La salle de bains bien équippée et aussi spacieuse. L´hôtel est bien situé proche du métro Saint-Placide, du Bon Marché et de la rue Cherche-Midi avec ses boutiques et restos. Emplacement idéal pour découvrir la rive gauche!
Petit-déjeuner sur la chambre ou au sous-sol...produits frais, du bon pain, viennoiseries et un excellent café! 
L´hôtel est à recommander absolument!

When my husband needed a doctor, the managing Director Veronique quickly made an appointment with our Colette cardiologist within three hours of our need. 
We would certainly stay there again when in Paris, and recommend it to anyone considering staying a stay in Paris
Location, charm, friendly, professional staff.

Food choices through the day! Only breakfast available!

What a beautiful hotel. Pristine clean, spacious room with a leafy green courtyard for our personal use. It was decorated with antique furniture and a had a very comfortable bed. There were fresh flowers waiting for us as well as some other goodies for us to enjoy. The hotel was located perfectly within walking distance to all the major attractions, cafes and restaurants around Paris. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. They also provided a very good breakfast in a unique stone walled space downstairs. Highly recommended.
No mini bar in the room but that was not a big deal.

Beds and bedding comfortable, charming hotel, staff very friendly and helpful, safe, wonderful neighborhood, nice bathroom
A little warm some nights but if we opened our windows in the morning it was cool for the next night. Sometimes a bit loud on the street, so kept windows closed in the evening while sleeping.

The staff was very helpful on all shifts. Mr. Moustache had a great demeanor - professional, friendly and very helpful. The location is perfect for restaurants n shopping. The bed n shower pressure were amazing. Perfect for a single traveler!
Street noise is loud. The place could use a fresh coat of paint.

Great location in the St. German district (6th) located one block from the metro. Was on a quiet street with many restaurants nearby. The staff were great with particular mention of Thomas.
It’s a bit pricey, but you truly get what you pay for.

Gives an authentic french ambience, furniture and decorative features are very traditional, centrally located to everything (venues such as the Louvre, catacombs, Calife dinner, seine cruises, Norte dame, multiple parks, museums, restaurants) all very walkable. Staff is wonderful. We had fresh beautiful roses on our last night. They have a lovely lobby with free coffee and tea all day! (Yes, an expresso machine), umbrellas if you need to borrow one for the day (super helpful on those rainy days). The cleaning crew is phenomenal and very friendly, they will exchange a full bottle of water for an empty one. The hotel is 2 small blocks away from the metro. The two lovely gentlemen you see on the website are the same ones you see every morning! They are sweet, helpful and very professional. The entire staff is amazing. We loved the experience so much, we booked the hotel again after coming back from Italy. We will definitely come back to this hotel again!
Super small elevator but honestly it added more charm to the place! We thought it was so cute and two people with luggage fit just fine

Everything! Staff exceptional, breakfast perfect, room large and clean.
Would have liked a small refrigerator in the room..

All the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Paris. Our room was a good size and a very comfortable bed. We also had a kettle and tea making facilities in our room. Breakfast was excellent and served by a very friendly staff member.
Nothing

The staff were very helpful, accommodating and met our every need. The location was great, close to everything but on a quieter street. Highly recommend.

Room size was amazing!
Comfortable bed!

This is the perfect boutique hotel for a short stay in Paris. The neighbourhood is one of the best in the city, in my opinion, and everything we wanted was very close to hand. The staff are gracious and friendly, the rooms are well decorated and clean; a little on the small side but then it's Paris. We loved the way that the breakfast came served to our room with not a plastic container in sight! Everything carefully and thoughtfully laid out in little dishes and on a nice tray. We will come back, definitely.

The staff were so friendly and helpful. I feel that we were treated like family, and everyone was eager to make sure we had everything we needed. Being a small hotel, we received the personal touch, and it was lovely to be greeted by reception staff who knew your name. The area was close to bars,shopping, and restaurants, but the street itself was so peaceful. Bed was very comfy as well and good quality linen. Although we didn't put hanger on door asking for room to be serviced,fresh towels provided and tea tray always refreshed.

Spotless room, cleaned every day. Comfortable bed and lots of hot water and water pressure in the tub/shower. Fresh flowers in our room. Windows opened for fresh air. Kind, helpful staff, all of whom spoke English. Good sized room, especially for Paris. Breakfast was cold meats and cheeses and pastries and yogurt with the option to order cooked eggs. Macarons and bottled water provided. On a quiet sidesteps but very close to metro station. Loved the 24 hour front desk.
Elevator very small (typical for europe), tight winding stairs could be difficult for some (not for us). No mini fridge in the room.

Excellent hotel with a wonderful staff. Highly recommended. Wonderful neighborhood.

What a beautiful hotel! We had a lovely time here on our recent visit to Paris. From the moment we booked, the communication was brilliant and that continued throughout our stay. We were celebrating a special anniversary and the staff and owner went out of their way to make our visit special and memorable! 

The location is excellent - easy walking distance to most of the central city attractions, and two minutes walk from a metro station. Lots of good bars and restaurants close by, and 25 minutes by metro to the Gard du Nord. Absolutely recommend - lots of thoughtful detail and a truly Parisian stay!
Nothing - perfect as it was!

Friendly attentive staff, great service and breakfast. Great location close to Paris Saint Germain.

Lovely property. Room was beautiful with fresh roses awaiting us.
There was nothing we didn’t like. We loved our bright, sun filled room with balcony. We loved the little beautifully furnished lobby with a great espresso machine with cakes and goodies available. The staff were 
remarkable. So friendly, helpful and professional. Everything an old world, boutique hotel should be. 💗

Breakfast was delicious…room was not the typical ‘small’ Parisian size - perfect size with even a balcony; cleanliness & change of towels daily nice touch; very nice & helpful staff; loved that we were only a few minutes walk to Metrotrain, cafe’s/restaurants/shopping & patisserie’s. Just a 9 minute walk to Luxembourg Gardens!
Liked all!

The hotel had beautiful touches that made it really feel like a treat to stay in - it was comfortable, spotless and the staff went out of their way to ensure we were supported.
The bar opposite was quite noisy on Saturday night..!

Hotel was charming! Great place to experience local culture. Staff was most friendly and accommodating, providing recommendations on local restaurants that were great! Definitely would stay there again!
Small washcloths were not provided in the bathrooms, but not a big deal.

Beautiful room. very comfy
Not really a problem but think a sink in the toilet and bin in the toilet was needed. as three people on one room was hard keep going into the bathroom

Excellent location. Friendly staff. Breakfast was greatly enjoyed by the elder two in our group… we opted to have breakfast in local cafe.,
V clean. V comfortable bed and crisp linen. Not most modern shower but very good.

It was clean!! and easy to get in and out of the hotel. The staff was friendly. The bathrooms were a good size. The water pressure was wonderful!
There wasn’t anything that our family didn’t like. If I had to pick anything….it would be my hairdryer didn’t like using the converter in the bathroom. Not sure the property could have done anything about that.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Very comfortable rooms with top quality beds and bedding. Beautiful Parisian style hotel in a quiet yet central neighborhood.

Great boutique hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Perfect location for us too.

The hotel is super well located and extremely charming. It's clean and simple but with some nice touches/aesthetics that really make you feel like you're in Paris. Staff are super friendly.

Everything! First impression was the staff, they were so kind and polite. Next was the reception area, it was clean and tidy, they also have a coffee machine (which is really good) and a tiny backyard to spend some time. Reception staff were able to arrange an early check-in for me as I arrived earlier and provided me with a city map which was helpful. The room was very fresh and clean, everything was there. Bed and pillows were so soft and comfortable to sleep in. We wrote a note that we wanted a room on the top floor and they were able to arrange it for us, so we enjoyed the view of the top of Eiffel tower in the evenings. The location was very livable, there are a lot of cafes and restaurants nearby, a shopping centre is 7min by walk and Luxembourg park is 10min by foot. Although, there many places to eat and drink, the street is always quite, no noise at all. We have a wonderful stay there!
We don’t have a thing that we don’t like there.

The staff were super friendly and helpful and the location of this hotel is great. Local restaurants, cafes and bars within 3 minutes walking distance. 15 minute walk from Bon Marche and excellent metro/bus connections. There is a lovely lounge area with a fire in the winter where you can relax or have a glass of wine. The rooms were spacious for Paris with excellent facilities and wonderful beds and bedlinen ! Also, fantastic air conditioning which was essential in 34 degrees heat. Very quiet street as well. Plenty of storage space for clothes.
There was nothing we didn't like but would like to suggest the addition of a mini fridge in the room.

I can only say what was not horrible. The breakfast was just ok, but the woman who served breakfast was the nicest person you will ever meet in Paris, so cheerful and pleasant. She deserves 5 stars.
This claims to be a 4 star hotel, but it lacks the official French credentials to call itself 4 star. There should be a placard outside the hotel, but there was none. We paid 4 star prices and got a 2-3 star room. Our room was tiny, much smaller than shown on the web site. There was about 1 foot clearance between the bed and the wall. The room was so tiny it did not even have a chair, and they had to use the tiny nightstand on the side of the bed for the coffee service. You could not open the bathroom door without rearranging things because there was no room for luggage. The safe was on the floor of the closet. My wife and I felt so cramped we left a night early.

I just couldn’t cope with the room size, I could not roll my suitcase between the bed and the table and when it was open I could not get into the bathroom.

The location was good, Metro and good brasseries nearby.
The price charged during our stay was very very high. And the City Tax was tripled (over the level when we booked). Completely soured the visit.

O pequeno almoço penso que seria numa cave. Vimos que a menos de 50m havia múltiplas óptimas esplanadas, pelo que decidimos ir lá logo de manhã. O hotel fica numa rua secundária mas perto do metro e muitíssimo central. Como apanhamos uma vaga de calor foi muito agradável poder dormir com uma das duas janelas do quarto aberta. Apesar de darem directamente para a rua.

full_description:
L’Hôtel Odyssey est un établissement design qui propose des chambres insonorisées avec connexion Wi-Fi gratuite. Le musée du Louvre se trouve à seulement 600 mètres.

Décorées dans un style ultramoderne, les chambres disposent toutes d'une télévision à écran plat. Un smartphone que vous pourrez utiliser pendant votre séjour est fourni. Les salles de bains privatives aux parois vitrées sont pourvues d'une douche et d'un sèche-cheveux.

Un petit-déjeuner buffet est préparé chaque matin à l'Hôtel Odyssey et peut vous être servi en chambre sur demande. Vous pourrez prendre un verre au bar O'nesty (sauf lors d'événements privés).

L’établissement vous place à 450 mètres de la station de métro et de RER de Châtelet-Les-Halles, d’où vous pourrez rejoindre directement l’aéroport de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle. Le jardin des Tuileries est accessible en 15 minutes à pied.

Des conditions différentes et des suppléments peuvent s’appliquer pour les réservations de plus de 4 chambres.

il faut tout casser . IMPRESSION D'ETOUFFEMENT DANS CES CHAMBRES . Il faut expliquer au décorateur ( qui se vante de sa production en plus ...) qu'on a arrêté la moquette depuis un moment à cause des allergies , qu'on doit pouvoir tenir debout à deux dans une chambre pour deux , Y ouvrir ses valises , déballer ses affaires ,que le concept de salle de bain ouverte est sympa dans une très grande chambre , mais là on dirait qu'on partage une cellule .A peu près rien pour poser ses affaires dans la zone-lavabo, et il ne faut pas avoir de trop grands bras si vous êtes porteurs de lentilles .l'éclairage est soit très puissant ( ambiance taularde ) ou vraiment la liseuse ... Inadmissible pour ce qu'on est en droit d'attendre pour un trois étoiles , surtout au prix payé .

Nous avons passé deux nuits dans cet hôtel vraiment charmant ! les chambres sont certes petites mais le design est unique et rappelle 2001 l’Odyssey de l’Espace, le matelas est très comfortable et le personnel absolument charmant. L’emplacement à deux pas de Châtelet Les Halles est idéal. Malgré la localisation centrale de l’hôtel, il est situé dans une petite rue très calme et les chambres sont bien insonorisée et isolées de la lumière donc parfait pour passer des nuits au calme total. Nous n’avons pas pris le petit déjeuner sur place afin de visiter d’autres lieux aux alentours donc on ne peut pas donner notre avis là-dessus. Nous y reviendrons c’est certain!

Petit-déjeuner copieux
Chambre a peine plus grande que le lit.fuite des écoulements de douche....toute la moquette de la chambre (2m2...)trempée.incident signale a chaque réceptionniste croisé (3) sans conséquence....chambre a 340 euros car reveillon du nouvel an.pas une bouteille d eau et évidemment ni bar ni frigo ni bouilloire.un fond de savon liquide dans la douche....vue sur cour....c est a dire sur mur...bref rien rien rien de bien terrible!!!

l’emplacement / l’accueil du personnel / literie
certainement que la fermeture longue durée de l’hôtel en raison du Covid n’a pas facilité les choses. Odeur d’égout dans la salle de bain les siphons sont certainement à nettoyer. Le sèche-cheveux réparé au scotch très moyen pour un hôtel de cette gamme. Et enfin, la housse de couette tachée. Si l’on peut considérer qu’elle était propre cela ne laisse pas une bonne impression.

Le point positif était la personne qui nous a accueillis : très gentille et agréable. Il y avait un bruit dans notre chambre et cette personne s’est montrée très réactive en nous changeant tout de suite de chambre.
Autre point positif : le calme.
Dans les deux chambres il y avait de nombreux cheveux dans lit, sur l’oreiller et même entre le drap du dessous et le matelas (ils se voyaient en transparence). La moquette était tachée et décolorée et ne correspond donc plus aux images de Booking.com 
Il y avait des traces de nourritures restées collées sur la tablette en bois de la chambre et de la poussière dans les recoins.
S’agissant du petit déjeuner, on nous avait dit à l’arrivée d’appeler dans la matinée entre 7h et 11h et qu’il serait apporté dans notre chambre, la cuisine étant en travaux. Le 2e jour nous avons donc appelé à 9h30 pour commander le petit déjeuner. La personne nous a demandé ce que nous voulions. Nous avons du demander ce qu’ils proposaient. Suite à ce qu’on nous indiquait nous avons commandé des viennoiseries et des boissons ainsi que pain et confiture. Puis la personne au téléphone nous a dit après réflexion qu’elle allait vérifier si elle avait toujours ce qu’elle nous proposait pour ensuite revenir et nous dire qu’elle n’avait en réalité plus rien… donc pas de petit déjeuner pour nous.

The check-in process was seamless, and the staff members were incredibly attentive to my needs. The room was not only impeccably clean but also thoughtfully designed, offering a perfect blend of comfort and modern amenities. The attention to detail in the room decor and furnishings did not go unnoticed.
Throughout my stay, I was consistently impressed by the level of service provided by the hotel staff. They were always ready to assist with a friendly smile, whether it was providing local recommendations, arranging transportation, or ensuring my stay was as comfortable as possible.
The hotel's amenities exceeded my expectations. Additionally, the hotel's central location made it convenient for exploring the surrounding area.
One Staff member in the breakfast room was abrasive, insultive and condescending. The front dest handled the situation very professionally and provided a very amicable solution that we were pleased with.

I had asked for the room to be available from 12pm as I arrived at that time and I had to change for a work meeting in the afternoon. The hotel told me in advance they couldn't guarantee it would be ready. Indeed it wasn't ready when I arrived. I was able to change in the communal bathroom and to leave my luggage, which was fine, but had the staff made it possible to get the room on time, that would have been 'going the extra mile for customer satisfaction', and certainly more comfortable for me. That said, the staff was generally nice, polite and helpful.

Me and other guests were robbed from the hotel safe!!!!!! 
I came to Paris and stayed at this hotel. First of all staff is not present 24/7 so from the get go i didn’t feel very secure at night as the loby was often empty. I put money in the safe on the first day, and the money I put in was a very specific amount that was not to be spent in Paris, and thus I kept it in the safe over my 4 day stay. On the last day I realized that while my safe was closed it still opened and 200 euros were missing. Naturally I thought maybe I miss counted my money but other hotel guests quickly expressed that they also had money missing from the safe. I am so disappointed and terrified and to be honest I feel so violated. I spoke to the manager of the hotel and he completely dismissed me, yelled at me and the other guests who also had money stolen. We are currently in contact with the paris police to resolve this issue. While the manager was rude and unhelpful - the receptionists and day staff were friendly and really felt for us. 

Please do not come to this hotel and be safe!!!!!

stolen money from safe. All 3 rooms that our group rented had a total of 1000€ missing. Manager of hotel was extremely rude and defensive with no resolution. The manager yelled at a group of girls once we announced that if there is no resolution we will have to write a bad review. He said that we need to get a lawyer if we have any complaints. This is unacceptable.

full_description:
L'hôtel Baldi est situé à 8 minutes à pied du bâtiment classé au patrimoine mondial de l'UNESCO ainsi qu’à seulement 20 minutes de marche de la Tour Eiffel et de la Tour Montparnasse.

Les chambres comprennent la climatisation et une télévision par satellite à écran LCD. Vous disposerez également d'un minibar et d'une salle de bains privative pourvue d'articles de toilette offerts.

Un petit-déjeuner à emporter est proposé tous les matins. Vous pourrez également déguster votre petit-déjeuner dans le confort de votre hébergement.

Cet hôtel possède en outre une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite et une réception ouverte 24h/24. Les stations de métro Ségur et Cambronne sont accessibles en 3 minutes à pied.
L'hôtel BALDI a reçu le label CLEF VERTE en 2020.

la taille de la chambre était parfaite avec un bureau repliable pour gagner de la place, 
une salle de bain indépendante avec une fenêtre, entièrement rénovée , propre et avec de la place
la literie est confortable, 
il y'a de nombreuses prises pour pouvoir brancher ordinateur/téléphone, 
il y'a une étagère et une penderie, 
le wifi est disponible, 
il y'a deux formules de petit déjeuner (sur place et à emporter),
des boissons fraiches sont proposées à l'accueil à un tarif raisonnable,
l'accueil est chaleureux
on n'entend pas la circulation ou le métro
le métro se trouve à 3 mn à pied 
la ligne de métro dessert les gares Montparnasse et Bercy 
l'autre ligne de métro (à 5mn à pied) permet de rejoindre la gare d'Austerlitz et dessert Sèvres Babylone, Odéon
le quartier dispose de nombreux restaurants ou des cafés très agréables
pour ceux qui viennent en voiture, parking en face de l'hôtel
le frigo ne fonctionne pas normalement : il dégage une odeur désagréable dans toute la chambre (à changer SVP),
la moquette du sol est très fatiguée et ne donne pas envie de poser les pieds dessus (à remplacer),
la porte de service a été claquée 10 fois le matin ! impossible de dormir ! mettez un groom aux portes de services SVP
on entend la conversation dans le couloir, il y'a un jour d'1 cm sous la porte, (capitonnez les portes des chambres SVP)
le paiement par chèque vacance n'est pas proposé (un basique pour Paris !)

Hotel is in a very handy location - minutes from two train stations and about 15 min from the tower. Also good coffee just around the corner and staff was super friendly, let us in way earlier because the previous guest did not show up. Breakfast is decent and the room is clean. Bed and pillows are comfortable. Lift is small (it only fits two people) but I won’t add this to the cons as I think this adds character to the building :) Some people complain the room is too small or the lift but this is centre Paris and an old building, you need to do your research so you know what to expect.
Only thing I would mention is the carpet is quite old but I believe they are replacing it in the rooms as on other rooms we saw it was laminate instead. Also shower can be quite slippery when you drop soap on the floor while showering.

The staff was super friendly, many thanks to Roselie for making our stay comfortable. She is the best. This hotel is close to Eiffel Tower, you can reach there by walk in 10 minutes. Even Louvre museum is not so far away if one enjoys to walk for 40 minutes, one can take short breaks in between as there are many nice places in between and also a great view of Eiffel tower from distance.
One can always whine about things but I would really like to thank all the staff for their dedication and hard work, please keep up the good work. Nothing in particular that I didn't like. One suggestion though please add one mirror in the room, it will help big time and if possible add scrambled eggs in your breakfast menu :)

full_description:
Installé à Paris, le Grand Pigalle Experimental vous accueille à 550 mètres du Moulin Rouge. Cet hôtel propose une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, la climatisation et un service de bagagerie.

Toutes les chambres sont desservies par un ascenseur et comprennent un téléphone, une radio, ainsi qu’une télévision par satellite à écran plat. Vous disposerez également d’une salle de bains pourvue d’’articles de toilette gratuits, d’un sèche-cheveux et d’une baignoire ou d’une douche.

Un restaurant et un bar sont présents sur place.

Le Grand Pigalle Experimental est situé à 100 mètres de la station de métro Pigalle et à 800 mètres de la basilique du Sacré-Cœur.

La vue sur les toits de Paris et en particulier le Sacré Coeur est fantastique. La décoration est parfaite.
