Le service du petit déjeuner n'est pas cohérent (nous avons l'impression de déranger la serveuse, le temps de réalisation des oeufs brouillés est bien trop long (le café est froid lorsqu'ils arrivent enfin au bout de 15 minutes).

Really nice place to stay. Good sized room for the area, comfy bed, and friendly staff. Conveniently located yet, considering the location, surprisingly quiet. Close to a lot of touristy areas, but just off the path enough to feel like you're in a "local" area.

Parisian style boutique with lots of traditional features and very helpful staff.

Very comfortable bed and bath facilities.

Stylish and comfortable, excellent location, wonderful staff

Great location. Quiet and very close to some awesome areas. The breakfast was lovely with many selections, generous, and so delicious. The views from our windows were picturesque Paris! Filled with history and a few blocks away from the craziness of the Moulin Rouge streets. The personal note in the room was special. The Mirror / TV was great to have but not be seen, in the room. The elevators are so tiny / old, so be very careful about suitcase size at this hotel.
The front desk staff could have been more forthcoming with the region, recommendations, and suggestions. Our roof level room had many ceiling angles created a feeling of being socked in. Next time, I would take a balcony room for ceiling height. There are skylights but we could not figure out how to close the light off. We chose the 6th floor for the space which was great with an added sitting area. The elevator only reaches the 5th floor, so to reach the 6th, a spiral staircase must be taken from 5th floor to 6th. It is very steep and difficult to manage with large suitcases or with any sort of leg issues. Choose 5th floor or less. The climate control was finicky, a little drafty when we could get it going. The hotel is much smaller than expected but lovely.

The rooms the ambience the service

Staff were fantastic

Beautiful boutique hotel in a fun location! The staff was very nice and upgraded us for our honeymoon. The room was very well decorated and we had a little view of opera.
Nothing. Prepare yourself for a small room but all Paris hotels are small.

It is our favorite hotel in Paris! And it never disappoints us. The location, friendly and attentive staff as well as cozy super clean rooms keep us coming back time after time ! Special thanks to Emma for creating a special atmosphere for my daughter’s birthday! Room upgrade, cake ordering ( it was absolutely delicious) and always stay in touch even before our arrival! Thanks to Olivia at the front desk for her friendly and thoughtful attention and service !
Highly recommended!

The location is excellent. It's right in the heart of the best eating area and very vibrant. It's easy to walk everywhere from here. I loved all of the amenities in the bathroom and thoughtful touches like a chocolate on our pillow. Best of all are the staff. The guy that served our breakfast was smiling all the time and very friendly as were the staff at the front desk. The breakfast was exceptional. Insanely good pancakes!
The room was on the small side and we were at the back so it was a bit dark. We didn't expect anything larger though as this is normal for Paris!

Great aesthetic and very friendly staff. The location was also great with many bars and restaurants nearby.

Modern, trendy, clean
Modern, comftable

Reception staff friendly and helpful. Room was a bit on the small side but well decorated and furnished. There were some great shops and restaurants right near the hotel.
The street was pretty noisy, but then that’s Paris. Also, the Metro line ran right underneath the hotel.

Room was small but didn't really matter to use since most of our time was spent out exploring Paris. The hotel is in a great location close to Montmartre and transit options. The staff was very helpful and we really loved our stay here! Only thing I would be aware of is the room got a bit stuffy at night so we had to open the window which introduced some street noise.
Really not much at all, just no air conditioning which is common in Paris

It’s cute, cosy
A bit small

Wonderful interior design and small, but lovely balconies.
The music at the reception area clashes with the music from the restaurant which results in a rather annoying undistinguishable noise. At breakfast, you are welcomed with loud music that seems mostly to serve the restaurant staff and ruins the otherwise easy going atmosphere of the hotel.

The location of the hotel is amazing. Close to the Montmarte area and the area of St Georges which was lovely. There are so many great bars and restaurants around and a really cool feel to the place. We had a balcony with seats which was a really great addition to the room and meant we enjoyed spending time in the room as well as exploring Paris. The bed was really comfy and we could see the sacre couer from the balcony. The staff were really helpful giving us a late check out as well and always nice and welcoming. My boyfriend was running the marathon and the day before and of the event they left notes and treats for him which was a really lovely touch.
The size of the room isn't very big. However that is very typical of Paris and so once we realised that it wasn't an issue! The bathroom didn't have a window so it felt a little bit damp but it wasn't a massive problem as we weren't there for long.

We arrived in Paris for our honeymoon and received the warmest welcome from the reception staff. We were lucky enough to get upgraded which was a wonderful surprise! The decor and design of the hotel is stunning, they really have finished it to a beautiful standard. The room was immaculate, as was the bathroom. We really appreciated the extra touches - soft fluffy towels and robes, slippers, high end toiletries, Nespresso machine, huge comfortable bed with crisp white sheets. Perfect in every way! The breakfast was brilliant, good choices and served in the lovely Frenchie restaurant. The location is fantastic too, we will definitely stay here again!

Everything! It really is our Parisian home! Such wonderful staff, nothing too much trouble! So friendly and helpful! gorgeous and chic room with the most comfortable bed. It was my birthday and they organised flowers. Excellent location. Just 10/10

Great location and tasteful decor. A small room - but had everything we needed. Bathroom was very nice.
No faults

The rooms were comfy, clean and had everything we needed. The staff were friendly and the location was excellent.
We booked a family room via booking.com which was described as two rooms with a central area with seating and television. This suited us because our daughter wanted privacy but not separation. On check-in we were told there was no such room.

Cutest gem in Pigalle! 
Great location, the staff upgraded us for the night, which was sooooo appreciated. We had to change our stay because we had a death in the family and chose to go leave Paris sooner than expected to attend a funeral, so changed our booking from 4 nights to 1. The room was amazing. The windows, the bathroom, the decor - loved all of it.

Excellent reception staff, gorgeous quirky rooms, good location.
The hotel restaurant food was good, but lacked welcome & ambience for breakfast.

The hotel is good located for public transport but at night there is a lot of noise as there are some cafes in the neighborhood.

The location was great, 3 minutes from Pigalle tube and the surrounding area was full of great bars and spots to eat. 5 minute walk to Montmartre which we loved. The breakfast was fantastic and all of the staff could not have been more welcoming. We were given a balcony in our room which was such a bonus and they had made extra efforts for my Mum's 60th Birthday by leaving a happy birthday message on the mirror. Lovely touch walking into the room and hearing some jazz music. I had paid a €70 for the fizz and fruit option and a lovely bottle of Champagne was already chilling in the room for our arrival.
The only thing I can feedback that I was disappointed about was the fruit platter that came alongside the fizz. It was 2 bananas, a mouldy pear and a soft apple which was all left untouched. I had envisioned and appetising fresh fruit platter sliced up to accompany the fizz (similar to how you serve the breakfast fruit). I wish it was only the bottle of fizz that was in the room as it almost cheapened it. Everything else was spot on and would come back to stay in future.

Every detail thought of. Wonderful staff. Very comfy beds
Tiny rooms

I love everything about this hotel, from the personalised welcome from the friendly staff to all the interactions with the people running the restaurant. Rooms are comfortable with nice jazz playing once you enter the room, beds are comfortable, room is dark when needed and the setting and design are on point. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough

Amazing hotel - very chic and typically French! The bed was comfortable and the pillows were really lovely, I loved the radio playing jazz when I walked in and the little balcony. The mini bar was really cute and well stocked and they had a travel plug free for use which is really thoughtful. The receptionist that welcomed us was warm and friendly and very helpful. Location is brilliant!
Noisy! If you are a light sleeper like I am make sure you bring something to drown out the noise - every step on the stairs and every door banging and people walking on the floor above me woke me up, the hotel is tirâtes opposite a bar so the people leaving at 2am also woke me up. The trains are quite loud too. But I would stay here again - just with earplugs.

The hotel is absolutely beautiful and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was gorgeous, so much that we did not want to leave. It was spacious despite what some of the reviews said..had gorgeous window balconies overlooking the streets, a wonderful fragrance as you entered, plush carpets, music playing, comfy slippers and robes and a welcome note. Cleanliness was exceptional. The bed was one of the comfiest I have slept in and the sheets felt luxurious. And the bathroom...again well decorated and exceptionally clean. I thoroughly enjoyed having a bath although it could do with a non slip mat due to the curve.
Only small things...a non slip mat for the bath and perhaps a second chair at the table.

We really enjoyed our stay at the grand pigalle, the rooms were so well designed and the interior is just beautiful, looks exactly like the photos. The staff were attentive and friendly. The view from our balcony made our trip to Paris.

A beautiful and quirky hotel in the heart of the Moulin Rouge district, with Montmartre on your doorstep and the loveliest cafes and shops around. The location is perfect and the interior of the rooms is beautiful and very Paris-like.

We loved our stay at Grand Pigalle! The room had so many lovely touches (e.g. French jazz playing on the stereo, bottled cocktails in the mini bar, plug adaptors, etc), was beautifully decorated and very clean and modern. The bed was big and very comfy, as were the towels. The bathroom had everything we could possibly need (hairdryer, face cloths, lovely shower products) and was also beautifully tiled. The staff were lovely and very responsive to anything we needed at any hour. The location was also brilliant - on a lovely street and very easy to get around, close to Gard du Nord & Pigalle metro.
The room was lovely but very cosy; it wasn't really big enough for 2 large suitcases and we were often stepping over them - but we spent most of the time outside of the hotel anyway so this didn't really matter, especially for just a few days. In future we would definitely stay at Grand Pigalle again, but book a larger room.

Stylish, contemporary, great location in trendy area

Location was excellent. Couldn’t be better.

I loved the décor of this hotel! The beds were super comfortable and the rooms were clean. Also the staff was very friendly and helpful. They even let me borrow an umbrella on a rainy day.
The place is a little small/narrow, but not horribly so. I imagine most places in Paris are.

Staff is really great and helpful, restaurant is excellent. Location is good. We enjoyed our stay here a lot!
The bed was a bit hard (for us) and the shower in the bath was not very nice. It would almost flood the bathroom and the shower head was not super comfortable. Fine for a bath though. However, all the other elements were super good - so this was not a huge deal for us.

everything! staff friendly, lovely breakfast, nice decor in the rooms. absolutely love the jazz in the room!

Perhaps a little unfair, but I would have liked a bigger lobby and bar/restaurant area. Travelling with a group of friends means that one’s often waiting for people, so a bar or lobby area would have been great. Still a lovely hotel though.

This is now my go to hotel to stay in Paris. The location is great, off the main strip of Pigalle but so close to wander up to Montmartre or down to SoPi. The staff are fantastic, always friendly and helpful and the 24 hour concierge is a great service. The beds are close to the best Ive slept in across Paris and the rooms are excellent, great layout, size and really well equipped. Finally, their restaurant Frenchie should be on everyone's list to eat at.
I would prefer a bigger safe, especially one that can hold a 13" laptop. The wireless timeout timing is a bit annoying

Beautiful quaint , the bathroom was wonderful

It's a great fun hotel in a great location, close to the main strip to wander but far enough to be out of the main tourist spot. Its really comfortable, wonderful bed, excellent hot shower and the staff are always happy and helpful. Finally the restaurant, great for breakfast but DO NOT miss a dinner experience there.
There were a few small things:
The safe was too small for me to fit my 13" laptop which was a worry.
The shower leaks onto the floor so each morning the bath mat is half soaked.
The WiFi consistently times your connection out even in the middle of using it

The room and reception staff were lovely but there was an issue with the plumbing (shower wasn't draining) so this put a dampener on my stay. However after I let management they gave me a discount which I appreciated.

location was great, modern clean room
the room was extremely tiny. with two travelers it was pretty uncomfortable managing the space and our luggage. I wish we had been offered an opportunity to view other rooms. The elevator was not working the whole time. we weren’t offered any checkout help and had to carry 5 pieces of luggage down 3 flights. I had asked for a room with a bathtub. I was told they were all booked but would be offered one as it became available, no one contacted me. we got drinks at the bar which for the price were less then 2 ounces. the last day room service didn’t knock until 4pm. at that point we didn’t want to leave so we stayed in a messy room. we got a balcony room and the building directly in front was being renovated. again wish we had been advised and offered options

I have stayed here for years.
On this visit the service was variable and the rooms seemed to have been made more normal and less delightful
Differences were no small toiletries only big bottles, less interesting mini bar and cocktails, less interesting furniture in the rooms
All was clean
When I arrived there was a charming receptionist 
When I left the receptionist was only interested in chatting with her friends
It’s become only good in parts which sad

The location was amazing within walkable distance to some monuments, the balcony in our room was perfectly parisian. The toiletries provided and the coffee machine were ace. It has a beautiful look and feel that makes you feel special.
There are two things I wasn't expecting - (i) the rooms are very small which I hadn't anticipated but then again it is Paris and this is typical of the location (ii) It was very loud near our room in the morning and this impacted the sleep and morning for us, as we only stayed there one night it was no big deal but if were there multiple nights this would have upsetting as we paid £240 per night

shower temp was hard to control

Nice decor
The noisiest hotel I’ve ever stayed in! We stayed for three nights and had to wear noise cancelling headphones just to get any sleep (the earplugs they leave for you in the room aren’t good enough). When we complained they said it’s just the area and there’s nothing they can do about it. But it wasn’t just the outside noise - you can hear EVERYTHING that goes on in the rooms either side of you. Also, we booked two rooms and on arrival only one of the rooms was upgraded. This meant we were left to decide with our friends who was getting the better room (for the same price!) Bit of an awkward start to the holiday. The hotel’s response was ‘surely one upgrade is better than nothing’. Yes - unless you’re the couple in the smaller room. Wouldn’t stay again.

Enjoyed our stay as our first choices were sold out, more good than bad and wouldn’t rule out staying again as it’s decent value compared to others in the area. 

1. Very comfortable bed and pillows, 
2. Very clean room (thank you to housekeeping who changed towels twice a day),
3. Varied and quality room service options from the restaurant downstairs, very well-stocked mini-bar if you wanted to use it, free water in the room 
4. Cool aesthetic design, large windows which open wide, 
5. Great location in terms of restaurants/metro/landmarks/walking,
6. Our 6th time in Paris and the room compares favourably in size to other hotels, 
7. Smooth check-in and check-out process,
8. Some staff were very friendly and helpful (thank you to Adele and the man who tried to resolve the issue with the safe as well as their colleague who checked us out at 6AM). 
9. Used the laundry service which was very quick 
10. Good selection of toiletries and hairdryer 
11. Towels were changed twice a day which was very helpful 
12. We had reservations elsewhere so didn’t use the restaurant but people we spoke to said they enjoyed it and it was great quality, it had a nice vibe
A few things to consider when booking but not all bad: 
1. The noise from the bars on the street (it didn’t bother me too much as I live in a city centre so am used to it but even I found my sleep disrupted, so some people may be put off). 
2. I would not recommend a room with the shower/wet room as it is inexplicably designed. We had to cross the shower to get to the toilet but the wet room takes a long time to drain. Shelves are awkwardly placed. However, the bathroom design looks great and is actually very spacious but is not practical. 
3. No coffee maker or kettle. Room service is very quick and good quality so not a problem for many people but I prefer to make a coffee or tea sometimes without needing to interact with anyone. 
4. Bed was super comfy but seemed slightly small, more like a double than a queen or king 
5. Small elevator might not be ideal for people with limited mobility but it’s typical of these old Parisian buildings 
6. We had an issue with the safe not working which I had to take the initiative to resolve myself by purchasing new batteries, which was not ideal but understandable as it was a bank holiday and the technician was not available immediately. The staff were very attentive especially Adele and her colleague who quickly tried to resolve it and were very apologetic as they would have moved us had the hotel not been fully booked. But something to bear in mind for future that changing the batteries will fix it!

Nice big room, really nice bed + sheets. Big bathroom, though for some reason the tub under the shower is only just wide enough to stand in. Staff were friendly, breakfast was simple but tasty.
Some rooms advertise 'views over Paris', so paid extra for that and but ended up with a view of a big brick wall from the first floor.

Good location, bed was comfy.
Room was extremely small, not a lot of storage or space, neighborhood is pretty noisy, which would be fine except you can hear everything in the hall of the hotel, people in the room next door, the pipes in the walls every time someone flushed a toilet. 
While the staff was very friendly and helpful when prompted, it wasn’t a very service oriented hotel.

The hotel is pretty and there was enough of space in room
We ordered the room with terrace (patio) we payed for it but we received different room, with small balcony. The coffee machine was not working and we heard from the receptionist that we can buy on in their restaurant … that is not how it should be solved …

Colazione buona,tipicamente francese
Posizione in un quartiere carino

Hotel molto bello, personale molto gentile. La nostra camera era piuttosto piccola, ma del resto non ci si aspetta di trovare ampi spazi a Parigi. Avevamo anche un terrazzino molto carino, che però abbiamo potuto sfruttare poco per via della pioggia. Tutto concentrato, ma non mancava nulla. Il bagno in perfetto stile parigino mi è piaciuto molto, anche perchè era dotato di tutto. Se viaggiate con solo il bagaglio a mano potete evitare di portarvi shampoo, balsamo ecc...perchè c'è davvero tutto! Consiglio anche colazione nella boulangerie appena sotto all'Hotel, ha tanti prodotti buonissimi sia per la colazione sia per un brunch.
Altra nota positiva, la fermata della metro a esattamente 1 minuto a piedi.
Nulla di strettamente legato all'Hotel o al personale, l'unica pecca a mio avviso è la gente che gira in zona, soprattutto alla sera. Spesso ci è capitato di vedere gente ubriaca, nulla di compromettente però diciamo non sempre mi sentivo proprio tranquilla. Si tratta di una zona con locali prettamente etnici, non proprio tipici parigini, quindi anche qui, se cercate locali tipici non è il massimo. Per il resto dall'Hotel si raggiungono tutte le attrazioni principali senza problemi e anche a piedi, perdersi nelle vie di Parigi è bellissimo.

Boendet på Grand Pigalle gjorde vår resa till Paris perfekt. Gatan utanför har lagom mycket liv och rörelse, inget som stör men som bidrar till atomsfären. Personalen var supertrevliga! Älskade allt med det här boendet.

Kleiderschrank war mit Kühlschrank, Tresor und Kaffeemaschine nebst Utensilien belegt und man musste quasi aus dem Koffer leben.

Vi gillade allting med detta hotell! De levererade en upplevelse i toppklass och jag tror bestämt att alla detaljer var rätt. Rummet var snyggt och välstädat. Sängen var skön. Att ha en Bluetooth-radio på rummet var mycket bra. 
Det fanns många bra små ställen att äta på i närheten och bagaren bredvid gjorde väldigt goda pain au chocolat som vi åt till frukost.
Det enda tråkiga var att vi behövde åka hem.

地理位置不错 床品舒适 房间装潢精致复古
不同楼层的同一种房型不一样，与图片完全不同。临近街边，凌晨较吵，提前一晚预定了早餐，第二天多次电话询问前台，等待一个多小时，最后酒店还是没有送早餐到房间。

Bra städning och trevlig personal. Badrummen upplevdes mycket fräscha och badrumsprodukterna var mycket bra, likaså den lilla biten choklad man fick efter städning varje dag.
Vi bodde i rum 307 och det var en mycket trist utsikt mot ”innergården”, sliten heltäckningsmatta på rummet och en fläck som ej gick bort i toaletten. Kuddarna var alldeles för stora och vi fick båda ganska ont i nacken. Det fanns en soffa på rummet men den var i ett så stickigt material att den kunde vi inte sitta på. Saknade också några krokar på väggen att hänga saker på. Väldigt lyhört ut mot korridoren så man vaknade när grannarna kom hem sent på natten.

Het is een leuk hotel, ziet er leuk uit, locatie lijkt op het eerste oog wat minder in Pigalle maar de straat waar het hotel ligt is leuk, leuke eettentjes en winkeltjes. Richting Montmartre/Sacrecoeur is 10 min lopen.
Wij hadden een kamer aan de achterkant op de 2e verdieping die erg warm was, later bleken wij niet de enigen te zijn die hier last van hadden, met het raam open was er een giga herrie vanbuitenaf van een airco unit oid. Dat zou blijkbaar van de achergelegen bakkerij afkomstig zijn. Herrie was zodanig hard dat we eerste nacht niet hebben kunnen slapen. Na klacht kregen we een nieuwe kamer op 5e verdieping, geluid was er nog steeds maar wel veel minder hard waardoor we wel konden slapen. Personeel heeft wel haar best gedaan maar was niet heel proactief.

full_description:
L'Hôtel AMI - Orso Hotels vous accueille dans le 15ème arrondissement de Paris. Ses chambres insonorisées disposent d'une télévision par satellite et d'une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite. Le parc des expositions de la Porte de Versailles, à 1,8 km, est directement accessible par les transports en commun.

Après vos sorties, vous aurez la possibilité de vous reposer dans le confortable salon de l’Hôtel AMI - Orso Hotels. Vous profiterez aussi d’une réception ouverte 24h/24 et d’un service de portier, même durant la nuit.

Vous bénéficierez également d’une application mobile donnant accès à plusieurs services en ligne, tels que l’enregistrement, des recommandations et des réservations de restaurants, la conciergerie ainsi que des cours de yoga en vidéo. Vous aurez également accès à la presse numérique.

Depuis la station de métro Vaugirard, à 160 mètres de l’Hôtel AMI - Orso Hotels, vous pourrez rejoindre directement le quartier de Montmartre et le Moulin Rouge. Enfin, vous vous trouverez à 2 km de la tour Eiffel.

Petite anecdote cocasse : 
Suite à l'entretien annuel du sol du hall d'entrée et de la réception, l'entrée de l'hôtel était inaccessible pour la soirée et la nuit. Afin de pouvoir rejoindre mes amis en ville, l'employée m'a donc annoncé qu'il fallait que je passe par la fenêtre de la réception avec un escabeau. Pas de souci, ça m'a bien fait rire et ça a bien fait rire mes amis qui m'ont raccompagnée en fin de soirée. J'aurais juste apprécié un petit café offert le lendemain comme petit geste commercial 😄 En tout cas, je suis prête pour les JO de Paris 😄

J'ai adoré :
La gentillesse du personnel,
Le calme de l'hôtel et son patio,
Le petit déjeuner jusqu'à 14h,
La politique environnementale que l'hôtel essaie d'instaurer,
Et surtout l'emplacement dans le quartier et la proximité du métro.
Les points à améliorer :
Pour ma part les coussins étaient un peu trop durs et la salle de bain vraiment petite.
Les double portes consécutives pour la chambre 22/23, je n'ai pas compris mais cela génait le passage avec la valise et faisait énormément de bruit. Du coup lorsque le voisin rentre on est réveillé.

Le personnel hyper souriant, adorable et serviable, les petites attentions qui font la différence comme l’eau à disposition, le fait que les enfants même en bas âge soient vraiment les bienvenus, la communication avant notre arrivée, le calme, les produits dans la chambre, l’ambiance générale qui est très accueillante et qui fait qu’on se sent vraiment à l’aise, bref on a tout aimé !

Les chambres sont petites mais la salle de bain encore plus. La porte coulissante laisse un espace et ne laisse aucune intimité lorsque l'on est au toilette. Le bruit de la rue est très présent dans la chambre, on entend parler les gens ainsi que les motos et les camions.

full_description:
L'ibis Budget Paris La Villette 19ème est situé à 2 minutes à pied du bassin de la Villette et à 2,1 km de la place de la République. Il propose une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite dans l'ensemble de ses locaux.

Chaque chambre comprend une télévision à écran plat et une salle de bains privative pourvue d’une douche.

La réception de l’établissement est ouverte 24h/24.

Vous séjournerez à 2,5 km de la basilique du Sacré-Cœur et à 3,2 km du centre Pompidou. Enfin, l’aéroport de Paris-Orly est accessible à 17 km de l’ibis Budget Paris La Villette 19ème. De plus, vous trouverez un parking privé sur place.

Situé à Paris, à 2,9 km de la gare de l'Est, le Novotel Paris 20 Belleville propose des hébergements avec une terrasse, un parking privé, un restaurant et un bar. Cet hôtel 4 étoiles propose une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, un service d'étage et une réception ouverte 24h/24. Cet établissement non-fumeurs se trouve à 3 km du Centre Pompidou.

Leur salle de bains privative est pourvue d'une douche et d'articles de toilette gratuits. Les logements disposent d'une télévision à écran plat et de la climatisation. Certains comprennent un balcon. Toutes sont équipées d'une armoire et d'une bouilloire.

Un petit-déjeuner buffet, continental ou américain est servi sur place.

Vous séjournerez à 3,4 km de la gare du Nord et à 3,8 km de l'opéra Bastille. L'aéroport de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle est implanté à 21 km.

Situé à Paris, à 7 minutes à pied de l'opéra Garnier, le Dream Hôtel Opéra & Spa propose une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite dans l'ensemble de ses locaux. Cet établissement se trouve à 15 minutes à pied du musée du Louvre.

Les chambres disposent de la climatisation ainsi que d'une salle de bains privative avec des articles de toilette gratuits et un sèche-cheveux. Elles sont également équipées d'une télévision à écran plat et d'une machine à café.

Le Dream Hôtel Opéra & Spa sert un petit-déjeuner buffet tous les jours et possède un bar où vous pourrez prendre un verre.

Le jardin des Tuileries se trouve à 1,2 km. Enfin, l'établissement est installé à 18 km de l'aéroport de Paris-Orly.

propreté et emplacement
Chambre soit disant insonorisée mais outre le bruit des voitures, nous entendions dès que quelqu'un passait dans le couloir des visiteurs aux femmes de chambre dès 8h du matin
De plus, petit déjeuner plus que médiocre aussi bien en terme de qualité que de quantité, nous sommes arrivés vers 10h30 et il n'y avait quasiment plus rien : 3 petits croissants et quelques bouts de fromage avec yaourts, bref nous le signalons au responsable qui nous dit que nous devons patienter car il faut que la personne qui assure le service fasse cuire les viennoiseries et fasse les œufs brouillés puisque le chef cuisinier n'est là que jusqu'à 7h et qu'ils ont eu plus de petits déjeuners que prévu. Au bout de 30 min toujours rien ils nous expliquent que le serveur ne peut pas tout faire, bref. De plus aucune table n'était débarrassée : je trouve cela inadmissible de la part d'un 4*, surtout que nous payons un service également qui n'était pas à la hauteur. Nous avons dû quasiment hausser le ton pour que finalement le responsable daigne ne pas nous faire payer les petits déjeuners, strict minimum, et nous faire une ristourne de 20 euros.
Dommage mais cet hôtel n'est donc pas à la hauteur d'un 4*

This is very useful when you are more than two people as you can communicate and share the rooms, but could be annoying if you don’t know your neighbours and if they are noisy.

The location was great, it was possible to walk to most places of interest. There are also 2 metro stations close.
The room was very small, much smaller than it looked in the pictures. We chose the room with private sauna, but the sauna is also very tiny, and not very well isolated, which made some of the heat to go through spaces that were not isolated, and not to get as warm as it could be. There is no fridge in the room.
The lift is very very very small - you can go through the stairs, but they are not very well lit and a little deep.

This is a small hotel but a bit of a gem. Location, great staff, very nice well-appointed rooms, interconnecting for family, price. All terrific. Our rooms were small but the cleanliness and the fixtures and fittings were excellent and the rooms on higher floors are bigger. The building has a lot of old character too and has been very carefully and faithfully restored. The staff were all excellent and incredibly helpful without exception.
The hotel is undergoing a refurbishment so the breakfast area was not quite completed. However with the imminent completion of the eating area, this becomes irrelevant. The staircases have been terrifically restored but are quite narrow and probably would not suit anyone with mobility or balance issues. The elevator is very small and used for transporting baggage only so the staircase is the mode of access to the floors above where the rooms are located.

Location. In addition, very quiet.
The elevator is too small but it works.

Found a piece dust on floor in the room but staffs top. Spa is a bit disappointed as small and not hot enough, could be better.

Very central to walk everywhere
Rooms very small 
Lift too small
Stairs very noisy

The location and the amazing staff
The elevator is enough for one person without luggages

Lovely view and terrace! Friendly staff thank you!

location is just fine, not too close to main tourist attractions but not too far either.
staffs are very friendly as well.
very small lift. dont test your bags size and just leave them to the staff member :D lol 
my room also considerably small if you bring big luggage, bigger than 20inch, it wont fit in the room so you might have to open it and close it everytime you use it.

Its perfect localization. Very nice servis. Very good breakfast.
Sauna wasnt private in roms… was in basement.

Very close to shops,cafes,shopping centres ect.
The cleaners do as fantastic job our rooms were immaculate,the beds are very comfortable and the room is tastefully decorated.

The rest of the staff are very pleasant and helpful.

I don’t use lifts so can’t complain,had plenty of exercise going up and down the stairs.
Bit pricey

Exceptionally friendly staff. Very helpful and comfortable place to stay in Paris.

Lovely little hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable, clean room but as mentioned the hotel rooms and the lift are tiny. Perfectly good for a short stay. Very good breakfast.
A little expensive for the size of room but that’s Paris! Made up by the overall experience.

Very easy location for both walking and for getting the metro.
The breakfast was sufficient to set you up for the morning.
Staff were very friendly and nice.
The noise from the stairs and corridor was very easily heard in the bedroom which would wake me up.

Friendly staff always willing to help
The very very small elevator was a never before experienced thing

great location , the room was big clean and comfortable the staff was super nice:)
we liked it !!
thanks a lot!

The location is great, near to everything. The room is very clean, small though. The breakfast was exactly how it should be. The staff also very helpful and friendly
Nothing

The staff were all very warm and friendly.
The property is very clean and newly renovated.
Lift is very small.

This little gem of a hotel has a fantastic location just a few feet off of Blvd Haussmann, convenient to Metro & buses, restaurants, pastry shops and shopping, and just a few minutes walk to Paris Opera House and Galeries Lafayette. Rooms are quite small, but very attractively furnished and extremely clean. Front desk staff were all welcoming, friendly and helpful.
Our room was quite small, but for our short stay, that was perfectly fine. We would not recommend for a long stay or if you just feel the need for lots of space. The elevator was so tiny, it could not accommodate guests plus luggage, but front desk staff were happy to immediately bring our bags to our room.

Great location, good size rooms all with ensuite, clean, comfortable beds.
Not a big issue but it has the smallest lift I have ever seen!

Good location - 7 minutes from the Gallery Lafayette. 
A clean room but small room - we took two rooms with a connecting door. 
Good staff, helped us with everything we needed. 
The only drawback of the hotel - a small elevator that fits only one person! They brought up our luggage one by one. And my family came up separately each time. The elevator is not suitable for big and fat people, keep that in
A very very small elevator is only suitable for one person with a trolley. Consider not suitable for big and fat people :(

The location was amazing. Walkable to a lot of Paris attractions and department stores (Lafayette and Printemps) Very close to Metro stations (to line M8 and M9) if you needed to go somewhere farther. The rooms were very nice, modern, and clean. Staff was very helpful in making reservations at restaurants and clear in communication. WiFi and hair dryer worked well.
The hotel itself was going under some construction while we were there (August 2023), so there was no "sleeping in" as there was construction going on in the morning (around 9am). Our room's toilet paper holder fell off the wall once, and there was a shelf in the bathroom that looked like it was about to fall off the wall -- almost made me feel like the construction was rushed for our room.
The elevator/lift was very small (even for Europe), but still functioned great.
No fridges in rooms, but front desk allowed us to use their refrigerator/freezer.

Very nice little hotel - we travelled as a family of four, had two room with a connection door, which felt it was one appartment. Hotel personal was extraordinary friendly. The breakfast was nice as well.

Lovely hotel on quiet side street but close to many shops and walking distance from Opera. Rooms were modern, well appointed and with double fire doors helping to soundproof from corridor/stairs. The breakfast looked lovely but sadly our schedule didn't allow breakfast. Staff very friendly and helpful. Well furnished and laid out extremely well to maximise the space. So actually no real complaints beyond the lift size. USB ports by bed both sides and full length mirror and a very powerful shower. And a decent Hairdryer not a bathroom hold-in type seen in a lot of hotels. Good array of teas coffees and chocolate almonds with complimentary toiletries in bathroom plus a decent TV should you wish to watch it.
Our room was 5th floor and the lift is miniscule. Not suitable for disabled guests if staying higher up building. Shame as lovely place. Definitely keeps you fit. Small room but as expected from Paris standards so all good.

Went above and beyond for us, setting up our room for our first day of our honeymoon! Great balcony outside and super comfy. Location is great, by the Opera and a lot of shopping/good food
Elevator that fits 1.5 people. Maybe 1. Maybe 2 if your very tiny. My husband and I could both fit if we jenga our bodies in. The room was also so so small there was barely any room for our luggage, had to maneuver each time we wanted out the door

location near laffayat 5 - 10 min walk
small elevator fit for two people only, expensive compared to 5 starts hotels nearby

Friendly staff, good location close to many metro stations and restaurants.
Rooms are a little small.

Very convenient, comfortable and very nice staff.
It could be small for some and the elevator is tiny.

The location of the hotel is amazing. The staff were so lovely and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable, while small, they are very well designed. Over all I loved our stay.
I expect a small room for such a great location in Paris, so this was not a problem. Would I have liked bigger - yes. The hotel is expensive, however, this is the price you pay for location and quality in Paris. The lift was very small (and we knew this from the reviews prior to coming) - I wasn't expecting it to be that small but it was incredibly entertaining every time we used the lift. Overall these things I 'liked least' did not impact our stay.

Perfect Paris boutique hotel
The stairs can be a challenge, but for me it was part of the charm

Good location overall and super friendly staff. Comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The Superior Room is a must for a better sized bathroom if you are a tall person. Breakfast was ok it had the essentials.
Small rooms overall so keep that in mind. The elevator is also very small but that's quite characteristic for the area in general. There were some slight issues with the warm water at one point but nothing too major.

boutique style and very convenient location
elevator to second floor too small

Nice staff

Great to have two connecting rooms for a family.

location, very quiet and clean, staff is very friendly and helpful, reasonable price
nothing

Has all you need for a short break - close to Metro, Boulevard Haussmann and surrounding area for shopping, restaurants, mini supermarket all a short walk away. Rooms comfortable and well presented. Mini fridge and tea/coffee maker provided.
Lift really only for luggage - stairs could be a challenge for some.

Pre-check in and arrival on the day were faultless. Reception was charming and efficient and bag delivery to the room was prompt and friendly. Everything was clean and in good order and the location is perfectly central for walking to all of Paris. Hamman is worth a go - again, all the staff were fantastically helpful. The lift is the smallest in the world but does the job if you aren't too big!
Room was small - but quiet and well appointed.

I liked the location and the staff
The noise from the traffic. Struggled to sleep through it.

Great location, excellent and friendly staff, clean room and nice breakfast.

the room was very nice and had everything that was needed
the elevator was very small and that was a little scary

superb location
lift is tiny but it’s an old building and great location

Hotel in perfect location for shopping and sightseeing. Friendly service oriented staff .
It feels a bit cramped, specifically the breakfast area is so small that you can't sit quietly. Value for money is okay but not better than that

We stayed on the top floor which had sauna in the room and a spacious balcony location was great close to many metro stations.all staff were really friendly and helpful
The room is extra small but this is expected with a small bouqtie hotel. The elevator was also really tiny and if you were a big person or had big luggages you wouldn't be able to fit

Hotel is in a decent location with easy access to the metro stations. 
Bed was very comfy, room was small but not an issue. 
The use of the hammam was an added bonus. 
All staff were very friendly and helpful.
Being British, we love a cup of tea and the tea bags and milk supplies were not replenished in the room and we had to keep asking reception for more but they were more than happy to do so!

The staff was the most amazing! they took every request very serious and were so helpful. We slept asked if we could have some bath slippers and some earplugs, because we ha a room on the street side of the building and the person I was traveling with is very sensitive to noise and we got the earplugs sooooo fast. the staff on the welcome desk was really friendly. for a short stay this hotel is perfect.

the location is amazing. it’s in the centre of Paris close to everything! the bed was also extremely comfortable and we had an amazing sleep. the staff are also lovely
the rooms are smaller than the pictures show. But space is a commodity in Paris especially central Paris. So it’s to be expected

Lovely hotel in a good location a few short blocks from the opera house.

breakfast
maybe overpriced

Nice little and clean hotel
Central location
(Tiniest elevator, not for claustrophobia, seriously, my shoulder could only fit in one direction... ;-))

Small rooms, but very clean and very helpfull people in the Hotel.
A little bit more space would be nice, but it was not a big problem.

N/a
The lift, getting luggage to room.

The location was perfect. It was easy to get around.

The room was a decent size for Paris, with a comfortable bed. We took advantage of the hammam which was a very nice addition. This hotel is in a good walkable location with convenient metro access nearby.
The sink was was awkwardly far away from the toilet - halfway across the room. The lift was too small for luggage -- I had extra bags from an extended trip so getting them down the stairs was an adventure.

Hood location that offered everything you needed
small lift

staff super helpful. location is very good.
rooms are a bit too small and the elevador fits only 2 without luggage

staff service!
the elevator is the smallest I’ve ever seen ;)

I did not, properly understand the parking. The manager was great and made things work out for us.

All excellent!

location/bed place

excellent position in the centre of Paris, staff was great and even taught me a little French. Superb!
Room was a little small for a five night stay (will book a bigger room for the future) but we managed nonetheless.

the hotel was very nice and the reception guys son nice and helpful, I loved the stay late breakfast till 12’
nothing

The hotel is very central and exceptionally close to the main plazas. Though the street looks kind of shabby, it is a quite and a safe place. Also if you happen to check the next street, you will see a beautiful view of the Basilica. A bunch of restaurants and cafes nearby for food.
The room was rather small, we actually marvelled at the architect as like who actually could have used the whole space soo efficiently, but that might be my bad once again cause I do remember seeing a warning regarding the room size.

location
small room

What a lovely little hotel! The location is perfect, and the design of the rooms (although they weren't huge) was superb. The terrace was fantastic! We had a wonderful four days staying here. The staff were just great, especially Ahmed the manager - he's such a nice guy. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
The lift is very small, so I'd keep that in mind if you have mobility/claustrophobia issues. It's a small hotel, so the stairs are easy enough.

air conditioning

good location

Comfortable beds, clean, good location, friendly staff.

It's a charming small hotel with extraordinary friendly and serviceminded staff and perfectly located in the centre of Paris. Nice breakfast with everything you need.
The bathroom is very nice but in my opinion missing one shelf for your personal stuff

Excellent location friendly helpful staff
Rooms were a bit small

The location couldnt be beat. Close enough to the train station with two major lines, bur far enough away to be quiet.
Room was a little small but as advertised.

The first (check-in) and last (check-out) employees were extremely nice and incredibly helpful and attentive. The inside court window had no noise and allowed us to open it at night for fresh air (because the air conditioning did not work). Great water pressure. Also an elevator although very small.
There are supposed to be essential oil pods and there weren't. There was no air conditioning even though it was advertised. The noise isolation within the hotel despite it being advertised was lacking. The kettle was dirty as well as it's filter (we put the filter on the side for the cleaner to see it but they threw away the filter and left the kettle dirty it was brown at the bottom). When they are cleaning the rooms (the hallways are narrow) and there are just bags of towels and garbage. The night time receptionist made no effort whatsoever (we requested the essential oils specifically he could not find them because the cleaning ladies kept stock of them and, there was no air conditioning) as he informed us and there was nothing done about it nor were we compensated.

ver clean , cosy , staff very helpful

The location is strategic: so near to Metro, restaurants, and shopping center.
The rooms and stairways are rather small. But that is typical for Paris hotels.

Super friendly staff very keen to help, smooth check in process and always someone available if needed. 
The location is excellent you cannot fault it and really great Metro links close by. 
Room was very clean :)
Room was very small however i expected this based on other reviews i'd seen. Tiny lift too but will fit the cases in! We were at the back of the hotel so noise was minimal accept for some rather loud singing one morning but it wasnt too early.

very good location but very small rooms and elevator

the location is great, quick access to the underground, nice area close to general stores Galeries Lafayette and Printemps, the breakfast is generous and of good products
the lift, the bathroom, both are small

Staff are truly top notch. Very helpful and friendly at all times. From the reception through to the cleaning crew. Great location.
It is a small hotel. Very narrow, from the staircase to the room etc. But all part of the charm of Paris I guess.

un the center
we had an interior room and in one of the buildings sharing the patio with the hotel they had a party with loud loud music, could not sleep until 3am. They told us that they could not do anything, that it happened several times before but the police would not intervene. At least they could reduce the price of these rooms…

The staff is good
Location is also very good

Central Hotel, very clean and comfortable rooms.
We were given a bigger room the second night which was fantastic. Thank you to the manager.
The lift is extremely small but this is to be expected in Paris.
The haman was nice but needs a small bench opposite to rest the feet on as hot steam burns the back of your legs when sitting in the steam room.

very friendly staff. room was exactly as expected. The location was walking distance from the Louvre and 2 minutes from the metro to access sites further away
N/A

The staff was very friendly and helpful with getting our luggage up to our rooms. The location was really nice, easy to get to via taxi and located close to the metro. The breakfast was exactly what you might expect at a hotel, it did the trick. Also, there were lots of bars and restaurants close by, so we found the neighborhood lively and fun.
Like most places in Paris the hotel was tiny, so that can't really be helped. However, we had selected a 
"2 bedroom apartment", and when we arrived we found out that meant two tiny rooms with a conjoining door. Also, when we asked for help bringing down our suitcases at check-out the staff said to just load the luggage in the elevator and they'd pick it up below. However, the elevator was so small my grandma's luggage couldn't fit. So my 80 year old grandpa and I had to take two suitcases down 4 flights of stairs. Not ideal if you're elderly, but if you're young and don't mind a small space, it isn't a bad hotel at all!

The bed was super comfy and large! and it was very central! In walking distance of most attractions. Staff were very friendly.
nothing

Nice hotel, close to metro, bus and centre. 
Breakfast is good, Different choices to choose from. Personal is very friendly and helpful. It was a good place.
Nothing really in particular. Just that the room and the lift are super small. The room is nice but just tight to move around. If you are most of the time outside its fine. 
One more thing: We arrived around 13.30-14h. The check-in is at 15h so we had to wait. I had the feeling you could enter your room earlier if you pay.

Staff very courteous and helpful. Very willing to accommodate. The room were very clean. And it was pretty quiet. Location is great, right by the Hausner Blvd.
The elevator is SOO small! Couldn't fit 2 persons inside. I don't think that it had more than 12" by 30" footprint. The breakfast was way too expensive.

Well located, many sites nearby within walking distance. Very nice and helpful staff. Quiet and clean rooms. Parking nearby.
The lift is really small (even for 1 person with 1 suitcase).

Clean, comfortable and lovely area. Staff were exceptionally helpful.

Firstly, the staff (especially Sofia), were extremely friendly and helpful in every way. They talked us through the check in/out process and it was very smooth. The room was lovely, very clean and we had a lovely skylight which brought in lots of natural light. We both said it was one of the best sleeps we had in a long time. The bed and pillows were very comfy and we even tried looking at the brand to see if we could buy some of the pillows for our own house! 
The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the Metro station which can take you all over the city which was fantastic, but also the location allows you to walk and explore the beautiful city, with most places being within 10-30 minutes walking distance.
So yes, the lift is extremely small and does not fit more than one person at a time, or maybe 2 small children...so wouldn't be suitable for you if you are claustrophobic. But we actually found it very quirky and funny and it gave us a good laugh at the same time. That would be the only negative.

Lovely boutique hotel. Very clean, friendly helpful staff. Lovely hot and cold breakfast.
Will definately stay again.
No complaints -)

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel! The room was very clean and quiet, making it easy to relax. The staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming, which made a great impression. I was pleasantly surprised with a complimentary room upgrade, which added an extra touch to my experience. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. There’s also a lovely Lactem Café nearby that serves an amazing pumpkin latte — definitely worth a try!
Nothing

Great location close to Opera. Restaurants near by. 
Warm welcome and very helpful staff. 
Comfortable beds. Clean rooms. 
Three connected rooms for family. 
Looked after luggage so great for the tourists who arrive early in check-in date or have a late flight on check-out date.
lift is tiny but can do the job.

The room was very spacious and quiet. Slept very well. The staff was amazing. They were very helpful and were willing to accommodate my needs. The service truly exceeded my expectations.
Not applicable

Very close to metro station main lines
As all paris the room is little enough for the people or the bags

Service, location and the facilities were great, good shower, coffee machine and air condition.
The elevator is for one person only. I recommend to use the stairs. Not a big problem.

Amazing staffs very friendly & helpful

Exceptionally clean and a very welcoming staff!
Location is great as well, everything is nearby. 
Perfect for a couple of days.

Very nice staff, perfect location, walking distance to all main attractions and very good breakfast. Highly recommended.

The hotel was very lovely with close proximity to attractions, transportation and restaurants. Charming and equally comfortable rooms albeit small. The sauna was an amazing feature to have. The balcony is a beautiful space to eat breakfast and relax. Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating with requests and suggestions. Charming boutique hotel that I would return to.
Nothing to dislike

There were so many amazing things about the hotel. First of all, everything was spotless and clean and new! It was beautifully decorated, with plugs next to both beds and reading lights as well. The location of hotel is superb, unbeatable. Close to metro and bus stations and walkable to most attractions in under 10 minutes. To top it off, the manager of the hotel - Paul Jotish Chandra was an absolute godsend. He was able to accommodate to our requests (several), and was incredibly patient and understanding.
None

good location. room is quiet, clean and comfortable. The reception staffs are very nice and helped me a lot.

Absolutely beautiful hotel spotless clean staff so nice will definitely be back

Amazing hotel great staff and breakfast fantastic location will definitely b back

Excellent location, amazing personal..

The staff is amazing and the host was perfect at the reception.

The location of the hotel wasn't bad, staff were helpful. Close to Opera and Strasbourg Saint Denis, so was practical to get around for meetings in Paris.
Despite being during the rugby word cup, the price of the room was extremely high given the very small double room we had. Terrible noise cancelling, you hear everything going on in other rooms and corridor. Elevator is too small to fit two adults and luggage. Overall was a very unpleasant stay.

serviço excelente

The location was great! We pretty much walked every where.
My room was a bit too small for 2 people but we managed.

Nicest staff, very accommodating and kind. We are a family of 5 and they have connecting rooms, so it was perfect. The location is great, especially if you want to be somewhat close to everything but not necessarily in tourist areas. A minute away from a metro station in a beautiful arrondissement. 
Beds are comfortable, rooms are clean. It is a boutique hotel so expect small spaces (small rooms, incredibly small lift).

THE AMAZING STAFF, HOSPITALITY WAS EXCEPTIONAL! I LOVED MY STAY. I OPTED TO UPGRADE TO THE SUITE FOR SPACE AND IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT, I'D HIGHLY RECOMMEND BOOKING THE TERRACE SUITE. BREAKFAST WAS GREAT AND THE HOTEL WAS VERY CLEAN AND MODERN. BEST I HAVE STAYED AT IN THE AREA. THERE'S ALSO LATE NIGHT EATS/HAUNTS IN WALKING DISTANCE WHICH IS GREAT IF LIKE ME, YOU SUFFER FROM JET LAG AND WANT DINNER AT 3AM! THANKS AGAIN DREAM HOTEL, IT WAS A LOVELY STAY AND I'LL BE BACK!
NOTHING TO NOTE, I LOVED THIS PLACE

The hotel was very good with a great location, the rooms were very clean and quiet and had a good size. The beds were very comfortable. The staff were friendly and kind. The elevator is small and has one person, which is not important at all because the hotel has many positive points. Overall, I was very satisfied and I recommend it to everyone and I will choose this hotel again.

Fantastic location— very walkable to many great restaurants and cafes, I love the neighborhood. Close to the metro as well. The staff were friendly and helpful during my stay. Room was small but very tidy and clean and the bed was comfortable.
I could hear EVERYTHING from the neighboring rooms. (But the street was quiet so hopefully you have quiet neighbors 😜)

Location
Did not give us our preferred room despite booking 4 months in advance. Breakfast was terrible

please see previous review.

The location is great
I cannot fathom how this is a 4 star. The room was tiny, so small that there are no bedside tables nor even a chair to sit on. The bathroom was so small that my knees touched the wall when using the toilet (apologies) and the shower, it was easier to dry yourself and dress in the shower than in the space. The TV reception was poor and only has a few French channels. The lobby of the hotel was basically a few tiny sofas infront of the checkin desk. The lift was only about 40cm wide so more like an upright coffin. if anyone is not petite or has any claustrophobia then you couldn’t come here. we had to go up and down the lift separately as a family. the bags had to travel separately. and the whole week we were here the road was being dug up so there were diggers and noise the whole day. a total nightmare. housekeeping didn’t turn up one day. There is also no Spa, the Hamman we were expecting in the room is a shower. there is no Hamman.

The hotel was quiet and very clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again. Thank you!!
I'm not used to small rooms, but it was fine. From what I hear, all the rooms in Europe are small.

the hotel staff they were amazing !! very friendly, welcoming, helpful .. really made our stay comfortable .
rooms are small but that’s France

This hotel has the smallest elevator I have ever seen. We've got two rooms with a connecting door for us and our kids, which was fantastic. The hotel is close to the Opera, only a few minutes to walk. Several Metro stations are also within walking distance. We didn't book breakfast. The rooms were tiny but sufficient.
The staff was very friendly, helpful, and courteous.

The room was very clean and staff were lovely and very helpful.
Although the location was perfect for our trip - right near the met stop, there was a significant amount of noise either due to cleaners or other guests in the hotel and the local roadworks meant that drilling and building works could be heard on weekdays from about 5/6am therefore we barely slept the whole trip!! The lift also is just about big enough to squeeze two averaged size people in - no room for bags or any space to even turn so definitely not suitable for luggage or families.

staff were excellent.. very friendly and accommodating… location was great, we walked to all parts of the City…

service, location, comfort of the room

The location is great. Many restaurants, shops, and attractions are within walking distance.

The selection is very limited, and they do not replenish it on a regular basis, so some dishes were empty every morning.

really enjoyed my stay , the employees were absolutely great definitely I’m coming back.

i would like to especially thank the amazing staff! they are super helpful and are making sure that we had a wonderful stay! the rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and you the location is just great.

Perfect location for seeing Paris, easy walk from Gare du Nord. Beautiful building as well.

the property was very clean and in an excellent location. The staff were very friendly.

Ein sehr süßes Hotel in guter Lage. Metrostation Richelieu Drouote ist nur 2 Gehminuten entfernt. Die Zimmer sind, wie in Paris üblich, sehr klein, aber liebevoll gestaltet. Reichhaltiges Frühstück in kleinem, sehr geschmackvoll eingrichtetem Frühstücksraum. Das Personal ist äußerst freundlich und zuvorkommend. Auf Fragen vor der Reise wurde zügig und entgegenkommend geantwortet. Wir haben uns sehr wohl und willkommen gefühlt. Es war ganz bestimmt nicht unser letzter Aufenthalt dort und ich empfehle dieses wunderbare Hotel gerne weiter.

full_description:
Occupant un bâtiment du XIXe siècle situé à 10 minutes à pied de la gare Saint-Lazare, l'Hotel Litteraire Le Swann, Premier Collection présente un thème littéraire qui honore l'écrivain Marcel Proust. Les Galeries Lafayette se trouvent à 1,3 km.

Les chambres modernes sont climatisées et sont dotées d'une télévision, d'un minibar et d'un assortiment de bienvenue comprenant une sélection de boissons chaudes. Tous les hébergements sont desservis par un ascenseur.

Un petit-déjeuner buffet varié est servi tous les jours sous un plafond en verre de style Art déco.

La réception de l'Hotel Litteraire Le Swann, Premier Collection est ouverte 24h/24. Des journaux sont disponibles gratuitement tous les jours et un service de nettoyage à sec est assuré sur demande. Vous pourrez apprécier une collection spéciale centrée sur Marcel Proust.

La station de métro Europe, située à 2 minutes de marche de l'hôtel, permet de rejoindre directement l'opéra Garnier et le cimetière du Père-Lachaise. Le Moulin-Rouge est à 15 minutes à pied.

La qualité de la literie, l’accueil du personnel (une mention particulière à Mr Loïc) qui s’applique à satisfaire ttes nos requêtes, la propreté, l’accessibilité, petit dej un peu cher mais très bon ,…. Je recommande cet établissement
Quelques degrés de plus dans les chambres seraient les bienvenu surtout après une journée dans le froid hivernal

Propreté

Très bel hôtel, décoration thématique réussie, bonne situation proche de plusieurs métros, personnel disponible et agréable.
Chambre un peu petite et encombrée. L'idée de mettre une bouteille en verre pour l'eau au lieu de bouteilles plastiques est bonne mais il faudrait des fontaines à eau à l'étage. Là, il faut descendre au restaurant pour la remplir, ce n'est pas très pratique. Ceci dit, le choix entre eau plate ou légèrement gazeuse est agréable.

Tout est plaisant dans cet hôtel, l'atmosphère littéraire et douce, les chambres claires et marquées par le souvenir de Marcel Proust. Confort, propreté, accueil agréable, petit-dejeuner copieux et varié. J'aime le Swann!
Idéal.. rien n'est négatif.

Très bien situé près de la gare saint Lazare il est très élégant dans ses couleurs noir et blanc. Plein de détails proustiens-une madeleine offerte, des portraits, la Recherche sur la table de chevet- mais pas le mauvais goût d'un décor "d'époque "!
Tout était absolument parfait.

Petit déjeuner excellent, très complet et copieux. L'emplacement est idéale, le métro est à 100 mètres. La chambre est spacieuse et ergonomique. L'emplacement au 6e étage nous donne une vue sur le dessus de la tour Eiffel et la chambre était très calme. Séjour très agréable dans l'ensemble.
La salle de bain n'était pas bien ventilée et beaucoup de condensation sur les murs et le miroir après une douche de 5 minutes. Le vélux aide mais il il ne faisait pas très chaud. Il manque aussi une étagère pour y déposer nos trousses de toilettes.

Très bon accueil de la part d'un personnel agréable et attentif. Les espaces communs de l'hôtel sont très agréables, y compris la salle où se déroule le petit déjeuner.
La chambre est franchement minuscule et le lit simple au confort plutôt spartiate, même pour un hôtel parisien. Agencement très étrange des chambres : on entre par... la salle de bains. C'est original mais bien peu pratique. Enorme souci le matin, mais indépendant de la volonté du personnel de l'hôtel : panne d'eau chaude ! Sans que je le demande il m'a été proposé de ne pas facturer le petit déjeuner. Mais, compte tenu du désagrément rencontré dans le contexte d'un voyage d'affaires, j'aurais été en droit d'attendre un dédommagement plus significatif. Bref, cette dernière mention explique la très mauvaise note attribuée à l'hôtel. Enfin, les prix pratiqués, très élevés même pour une chambre simple, me décourageront à l'avenir de réserver en ce lieu.

rien

J'ai aimé tambouriner sur les portes de l'hôtel entre deux quinze du matin et trois heures dix, par 2°C, parce que l'employé s'était endormi. J'ai aimé faire sonner le téléphone de l'accueil pendant une heure, appeler les Best Western voisins qui "ne comprenaient pas ce qui se passait". Je regrette simplement de n'avoir pas cédé à l'impatience et de ne pas m'être séparé des portes de la façon la plus directe et la plus logique.
Je n'ai pas apprécié, et ma conjointe non plus, d'attendre devant l'hôtel, de 2h15 du matin à 3h10, que le veilleur de nuit se réveille enfin, qu'à la relève du matin, il mente à sa collègue et qu'il lui parle d'une vague absence de dix minutes. Je n'ai pas apprécié que le Directeur de l'Hôtel ne prenne pas la peine de répondre à mon mail qui l'a, depuis, informé de ce qui s'était passé. Je n'ai pas apprécié de m'endormir - et ce, malgré la fatigue - seulement au petit matin et ai eu l'impression que la journée avait été partiellement gâchée par l'amateurisme d'un employé couvert par sa direction.

Accueil très chaleureux. C’est vraiment the place to be. Le lit était très confortable, Junior Suite propre et spacieux avec une petite terrasse et vue sur la Tour Eiffel (ou du moins une partie ;-))le personnel était toujours aux petits soins. Métro et restaurants à proximité ou sinon on peut tout faire à pied, c’est calme même si l’hôtel se trouve plus ou moins au centre. 
Un grand merci de tout cœur à toute l’équipe d’avoir contribué à ce que mon séjour soit exceptionnel. Je reviendrai c’est sûr ❤️

I travelled for work and was very pleasantly surprised by this property: the rooms were a great size, with a bathtub, with attentive staff. The location seems slightly out of the centre, but its proximity to multiple metro stations make travel very easy.

Absolutely loved our gorgeous little balcony with a view over the streets of Paris. Room was smaller than I thought it would be, but it did the job nicely for a few days. Bed was comfortable and rooms very clean. Location was great, we walked all around Paris from here, but for those less mobile, there are plenty of bus stops nearby too that go all over. We also used the bus service once or twice.
The bathroom in the rooms were lovely and clean, however, the frosted sliding door was not ideal. Although it provided visual privacy, it was literally right next to my Husband's side of the bed - and provided no sound proofing whatsoever!! Luckily, we've been together 25 years lol, However this would be LESS than ideal if you were staying with a new partner or a friend haha. I suppose you could always use the Hotel toilet if desperate- but for the price of the room, you shouldn't have to.

The staff were helpful and friendly also the area of the hotel is very decent and 8 mins walking to metro station, also the hotel is next to super markets and coiffeurs, rooms and toilets are clean
No AC in the rooms , i was in mid october and the weather was hot and only the heating system was on and no air so I was disappointed as I have paid for a 4 stars hotel and this was not the service that I expected so it was very disappointing to me, and when I asked them to change the heating system to cooling system they have sent me a fan , so I was frustrated , also the room is very bery tiny , the tiniest room in paris I have ever seen , no place to walk or to put my luggage , also the wardrobe is very narrow I could not put my jacket and my stuff into , the elevator was always busy and I had to wait few minutes to get to my room as their stuff is using in carrying towels and other things, also it is very small , did not fit all my luggage so I have to go down twice to get the rest of my bags

full_description:
L’Hotel Rochechouart - Orso Hotels est situé dans le quartier animé de Montmartre, à 10 minutes à pied de la basilique du Sacré-Cœur et du cabaret du Moulin Rouge. Aménagé dans un bâtiment Art déco rénové en 2021, l'Hotel Rochechouart - Orso Hotels bénéficie d'un toit-terrasse offrant une vue panoramique sur Paris.

Affichant une décoration Art déco, les chambres comportent la climatisation, une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, une télévision à écran plat et un plateau/bouilloire.

Un petit-déjeuner continental parisien est servi chaque matin dans le restaurant. Vous trouverez aussi plusieurs cafés et restaurants à moins de 15 minutes à pied de l'hôtel.

Vous séjournerez à 250 mètres des stations de métro Pigalle et Anvers, ainsi qu’à 1,1 km de la gare du Nord. L'avenue des Champs-Élysées est à 2,9 km de l'hôtel.

Lors de mon séjour à l'Hôtel Rochechouart, j'ai été enchantée par l'expérience. Les deux nuits passées là-bas ont été d'une douceur incomparable, notamment grâce au lit confortable qui invite à un repos. La vue depuis ma chambre sur le Sacré-Cœur était tout simplement magique, surtout au lever et au coucher du soleil. Un véritable cocon au cœur de Paris, alliant charme et élégance !
J'aurais cependant beaucoup apprécié la présence d'une baignoire ou d'un sauna pour compléter ce séjour et rendre l'expérience encore plus relaxante. Ce petit détail aurait apporté une touche supplémentaire de bien-être à un cadre déjà très agréable.

Le rooftop de l'hôtel est particulièrement mis en avant par les sites de réservation ainsi que par le personnel de l'hôtel, notamment pour sa vue sur Paris.
Pourtant, nous avons reçu un accueil déplorable : absence de politesse lors de notre arrivée, installés sur une table particulièrement mal située malgré le fait d'être client de l'hôtel, a pris notre carte de chambre sans explication et sans pouvoir nous la restituer....Inacceptable surtout au regard des prix affichés.

The location is exceptional and the view from the rooftop is absolutely wonderful. The interior of the hotel is great, well designed rooms and really cosy reception and restaurant areas. Breakfast buffet is also great with lots of hot and cold choices including honeycomb and a selection of cheeses. The staff were very friendly and helpful too.
The room was super tiny and there was too much furniture making it feel even smaller (although the bed was absolutely huge and very comfortable). 
The rooftop views were incredible but the rooftop bar is closed for the winter so the only way to enjoy it was to bring your own drink and sit in the cold. A few gas heaters would solve the problem as it's a shame to lose such a great feature of the hotel for the whole winter season.

Location on the edge on SoPi and a short walk from Gare Du Nord was perfect. 
The rooms are fair sized and very comfortable.
Maggies Bar was a really nice surprise as it was buzzy and staff were great.
Breakfast was a little chaotic and understaffed. Coffee machine was not able to cope with the volume of customers.

The room was lovely and a very comfortable bed. The breakfast was great and lovely ambience. The staff were were helpful. Generally it was great and highly recommended. Very nice location easy to get to from the station, loads of nice restaurants.

Breakfast very good. Location super.
Nice room looking out on street with a Juliette balcony.

The atmosphere and location were perfect. Such a wonderful local vibe. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly plus spoke fluent English.
The room was lovely but a minor issue was the lack of any bright light when needed.

The staff was super friendly – and the room was ready early (at 12pm) when we arrived after an overnight flight, which was very appreciated. The room was clean and spacious and had a great view of the main boulevard right in front. The breakfast was also very worth it, recommended to add to your stay. The neighbourhood was great, too.
Not much, to be honest! Everything met our expectations. I can't think of anything that I would suggest for improvements right now. Thanks for a great stay.

Great location, view was amazing and rooftop bar was a nice little bonus. Bed very comfy too!
Only negative was the housekeeping. When we arrived there was barely any shower gel left. We asked on multiple occasions but it never got refilled. We even went as far as taking the lid off and putting it on the sink to try remind them, but they just screwed the lid back on and didn't fill it up.

We were also only given one roll of toilet paper, and had to explicitly ask for more. Again I thought it was normal practice to replenish it if it was running low?

They also did not refill the coffee/milk.

For the price we were paying I'd expect housekeeping to be able to do the basics. Room was still clean though.

As a frequent visitor to Paris I was delighted by my stay at Hotel Rochechouart. Our room was spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The coffee machine was a welcome bonus. I will definitely choose this hotel again.

The staff were excellent . Very polite and helpful . The location was excellent

This was the perfect first stop after a 30+ hr commute from Australia. The staff were very welcoming particularly on Bastille Day weekend, where they had an influx of guests.
Appreciated it all. If I were splitting hairs, the only critique I'd have, is having a list of recommended restaurants ready to share with guests. Outside of that, it was perfect.

The staff and location were great as was the rooftop bar with amazing views of Sacre Coeur and The Eiffel Tower.
Nothing to dislike.

From the time we arrived to the day we left, we had a great experience. Michael at the front desk was very accommodating and helpful to get as settled in. The young lady at breakfast greets us with a smile every morning and serve us with a superb breakfast buffet. The young lady upstairs at Maggie Rooftop was very helpful and sensitive to our needs. Lochicj for our last day helped us with our transportation to the airport and made sure that we had everything we need before we left. Our room was great! Loved all the products used in the room from the bathroom to the mini bar. Our room was spacious enough for 4 adults, gets cleaned daily and is in an amazing location. Being very close to the Sacre Couer church , you can see the entire downtown Paris especially the light show of the Eiffel Tower every day at 11 PM, not to mention the illuminated Sacre Couer. Au revoir France!!

Travelled with my son this time, and this was a fabulous hotel for us, the staff were super accommodating, it has a great restaurant downstairs called Maggie, and a rooftop bar with views over Pigalle and Montmartre. Great location, an easy walk either down to the Louvre, or up to Sacre Coeur. Lovely room, friendly and vibey atmosphere, highly recommend this hotel. Note, we arrived Paris early and they let us to get changed to head out for the day, when we arrived back our bags were already in our room. That is a small detail but shows that they go out of their way to do the basic things right for their guests have a welcome and enjoyable stay.
