Shame the roof top was closed as it was winter but we were still allowed up to check out the view, it will be lovely in summer.

Great location , loved the old style of hotel . Beautiful roof terrace 
Lovely bath room 
Want to return

Friendly staff, beautifully decorated and great service

Brilliant view and lovely helpful staff.

Very convenient location (we travelled to see Moulin Rouge), although not our favourite in Paris. We enjoyed the aesthetics, design, and overall quality of the hotel. Great breakfast, very helpful staff!
Very dim lights in the bathroom - difficult to e.g. do makeup (it wasn't much better by the window in gloomy December!). It did give great ambient though

Everything. The location it’s amazing. The style and details. The restaurant and the staff.
Nothing

Had a wonderful time staying here. Management & Staff so friendly and accomodating. We had dinner in Restaurant for my birthday, the meal was delicious. Manager & Staff were excellent. I was presented with a birthday candle on my dessert and the band playing happy birthday. Such a memorable experience.
Close to station, walking distance to shopping district, Moulin Rouge and Sacre Couer..
Rooftop view was amazing! You could see Eiffel tower & sacre coeur 
Highly recommend staying here.
Loved it, thankyou :)

Decor and friendly staff
nothing

Gorgeous rooms and so comfortable. Great beds and pillows and bed linens, fresh paint, lots of closet space, and quiet on the 4th floor. The breakfast pastries are amazing- the croissant snail being the highlight.
Ok, so pigalle (the location of the hotel) isn’t fancy Paris, it’s a real neighborhood that isn’t super clean or chic-and may have a level of crime to correspond. It does have an amazing bakery around the corner (mamouche) and is near the metro. Check your bill carefully at the end-we had some restaurant charges that we didn’t make.

Ambience, decor and staff. Great view, great pofiteroles.
Bedroom was very small which made it hard for two people sharing. We were unable to open our small cabin suitcases on the floor.

Location was great for us, as we wanted to walk to Moulin Rouge and this was within walking distance. The hotel was Boujee and had a disco (bar) and dancing , a plus. They do provide breakfast, we don’t eat much, so passed, as it was a set price. Seeing Sacre Coure from our room was fun to see at night and again waking in the morning. I only wished for a tub, but I wouldn’t have had a view of the beautiful church, so there’s that … problem solved.
Nothing was wrong. I would suggest checking out this location to see if it works for you.

The bed was really comfortable. And I enjoyed the bathroom stuff, shampoo, soap etc. Also very friendly staff and the restaurant is really beautiful.
When I arrived one of the pillows was really dirty, also one of the bath towels and there were a lot of stains on the carpet, which probably were clean (couldnt get them out anymore) but it personally just digusts me a little. Also the remote for the tv was missing somehow?

Wonderful staff! Very kind and VERY helpful! Victor went way out of his way to help us ship a box home to the US. All the staff were wonderful.
Carpets in room could use a cleaning

The staff is kind, helpful and polite. Especially the team at the reception / the concierge person is adorable and so was the night person. The decor is always nice.
I have been staying at Rochechouart for almost 4 years and I m a bit disappointed the services are really going down in standard. They use to have a beautiful mini bar selection, the suite I stayed in was empty. Room service used to be open in the evening, there was none after 8pm. Same for the breakfast I called at 10:10 am and the waiter seemed annoyed and told me there were not serving after 10. No eggs or extra available. A lot of things became dysfunctional in the rooms : sink tap not working, shower head replaced but not working well. Bathroom door not closing properly.

We did get upgraded from the selected room right from the start, which is a plus. 
The room was very nice, not too much noise even though we were on the 1st floor.
The bathroom was exceptionally good, very big and comfortable
Within the room, the handles of the internal door were loose, with open screws that could potentially scratch us.
The lights only worked if the main room lights were on, so if i needed to go around the room at night I would need to turn all the lights on (waking up my partner).
The bathroom window was not blurred and had direct view to other windows, meaning that other people could see through it from outside, which is not comfortable at all.

The Dining Room

Location!!!!
It is an older facility but very clean and very accommodating staff

amazing staff and kudos to Redha the restaurant director
nothing

Dinner and breakfast were both first rate. Dinner had live jazz ensemble on Thursday evening.

So cute

Location, nice staff, stylish decor
Reception a bit inefficient at times though always very nice; no bidet! Eggs lukewarm at breakfast

location was perfection - view of Monmarte from our room and a stroll in any direction you will hit authentic Paris streets, shops, cafes and restaurants
Room was tiny but not unusual for Paris - and very very comfortable

We booked a junior suite and requested room with view of the Sacre Coeur and it was certainly the best view we could have asked for. The madeleines in reception were lovely too.
Wasn’t really anything, think the room could have had more decor on the wall but that was it really.

Great rooftop view. Staff were really friendly and helpful.

Great location close to Gare du Nord and to the metro as well as Montmartre.
We got a bigger room than we had booked with a stunning view of Sacre Coeur.
It was freezing cold in the room - the heating was not up to Winter teamperatures.
We arrived seperately and both had to pre-authorise the deposit, because there was apparently no record of it after the first time.

The decor and customer service were excellent
The pillows were very squishy and unsupportive

Loved the Location, the Decor, The Staff and the food. Exceptional service all round

Thought originally it was too remote but worked well with the metro and not far from anywhere central in taxis late at night
Liked the style, appreciated an upgrade and very useful to have a bistro on site for breakfast, drinks, dinner if needed
A little in need of an upgrade but didn't really bother me

Comfortable rooms with nice bed and and shower. Nice restaraunt area that we used for breakfast. All staff where helpfull and nice. Hotel walking distance from Grad du Norde (with light luggage)
Vegetarion/Vegan options at breackfast could have been better but there enough to make breakfst enjoyable.

Excellent location right across the street from La Cigale. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. The are lots of restaurants and a couple of grocery stores very close by. The bedding and bed was very comfortable.
I would have liked a little brighter lighting in the room.

Comfortable, clean, welcoming hotel in a lovely neighbourhood. Good links to transport (Metro). Friendly and helpful staff. I would recommend, and would stay again.

Staff were exceptionally helpful
lift was quite small

- the style of the hotel 
- the proximity to pigalle metro (2 lines that take you east/west and north/ south) and Montmartre 
- the rooftop views 
- the excellent viennoiseries at breakfast 
- the personal note at arrival 
- the cake in the hall :)
- low water pressure in the shower

Good location and very comfortable rooms anda good restraint.
The lift was very small but that is to do with the age of the building pre-dating 1890.

All good.

Staff were so helpful and friendly! Room was beautiful and clean! Will definitely be back

Location, style,music

The hotel location was excellent for our purposes. Walking distance from Montmartre and various Metro stations nearby. 
We had a junior suite which worked perfectly for the 3 of us. Also, we loved the breakfast.
I would have appreciated a few more hot food options at breakfast, especially bacon. The roof bar being closed during our visit was not well documented.

Hotel staff went above and beyond to make my stay fantastic. 
Responsive to messages and requests. 
Location and vibe of the hotel was just what I wanted from the holiday.
Rooftop bar was not open - but that couldn't be helped, it was the time of the year (October)

I had a fantastic stay at this hotel! The room was not only comfortable but thoughtfully designed with pleasing color schemes that made it a delight to be in. The staff was incredibly helpful, always ready to assist with a smile, which made the experience even more enjoyable.

The breakfast pastries were a highlight of my morning. They were exceptional and a delightful start to the day. The overall experience was a perfect blend of comfort, design, and exceptional service. I can't wait to visit again!
The only aspect I didn't enjoy as much was the Pigalle area where the hotel is situated in, which could be a bit crowded and occasionally sketchy. However, overall, my stay was quite pleasant and satisfying.

Interior style was great, fun disco
Breakfast was slow and unorganised

Location and room was quiet
10 spam messages from the hotel selling transport etc and a check in message that was just more marketing. I had to block them so unsure if they provide any useful communication.

The location is beautiful, it felt like walking into your own little neighbourhood with easy access to transport and local sites. Amazing cheese and meat shops, beautiful coffee. The building is incredible, the rooftop has an amazing view and you really feel like you have arrived in Paris.

Great location. Nice decor. Amazing view from rooftop bar.
Rooms are small but that’s normal in Paris. Great location makes up for it. A bit noisy as no soundproofing. So when housekeeping starts in morning there’s no chance of a lie in. But not noisy at night.

Lovely boutique style, great staff & nice decor. Fab location!
We couldn’t use the roof top first as of weather which was understandable but also because of private events. We weren’t forewarned which was disappointing as it was a reason for booking.

Location, super comfy bed, rooftop bar, staff
Foul smell in the bathroom - we did inform the hotel and hopefully they've addressed this :-)
Tiny lift
Very high prices at rooftop bar

Restaurant!!
Carpet. The hotel needs an update.

Loved the roof terrace for sunset drinks. Lovely staff. Good location and nice view if I leant out of the window. Room very clean. Mattress comfortable.
No where to put wash bags in the bathroom. The photo shows a marble shelf around the sink but our room did not have this. Tiny shower room.
I know rooms in Paris are small but for an Executive double I would expect somewhere to put a second wheelie bag without having to step over it to get into bed. Maybe remove the chair and put in a bag stand.

Great little room with a fantastic balcony and view. Friendly staff and good area for walking and exploring.
Room was a little small but to be expected in Paris.

Cute, historic hotel. Friendly staff and complementary madeleines when checking into room.
Didn’t offer complimentary conditioner, only shampoo.

Very comfy beds and a great location from the Gar du Nor
Got a surprise request of a deposit of 100 Euros on my card when I arrived. Paid it but as I wasn't expecting it would have appreciated a heads up via email that a deposit would be taken at the property

Perfectly located at the foot of the hill in Montmartre, the room was small but very nice. A pre-requested bottle of champagne with red roses pleasantly enhanced the mood of my special friend as we entered the room and this was again boosted as the windows opened into a glorious view across the districts old tin Parisian roofs and balcony's. The roof top cocktail bar presented even wider views across Paris in all its glorious 360 degrees. A wonderful stay.

Great location - close to Paris Nord station and Sacre Coeur. Great rooftop with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Sacre Coeur. Breakfast was nice, and the staff helpful.
Very pricey for the level of service. This was most likely because we happened to travel during the rugby world cup. The elevator is very very small!

Location was the best! At times the rooftop was not open when we thought it would be. And due to weather, wasn't open a lot too - even on cloudy days.
N/A

The room and location were excellent for our requirements. The staff were very nice and helpful.
No complaints.

Lovely boutique hotel with cosy and comfortable rooms. The restaurant is beautiful and the breakfast spread immense.
I didn’t get to use the rooftop bar as it was closed for bad weather. The restaurant is closed on Sunday and Mondays.

The restaurant is very good indeed – excellent service. I was interested by the menu section “les retours de voyage”. An obvious omission is the Gare du Nord. A French restaurant near where we live deals with by offering “Poisson frite à l’anglaise”. I would be more interested even what you came up with for Gare Montparnasse, Gare Saint-Lazare and Gare d’Austerlitz.
The rooms were excellent – quiet, good beds and coffee. Next time the power sockets are refreshed it would be useful to have sockets for USB chargers. For a wheelchair user, there were some issues with the bathroom - shower controls and towel racks should be lower. The floor should be more even. A stool should be standard.

The hotel was very comfortable with such friendly staff. We loved the rooftop bar that had a beautiful view of the city.

The hotel is very comfortable, clean and in a fantastic location. The bed and pillow were super comfortable. It is a hotel room so reasonable small but good storage for luggage. There is a small fridge so you can put a small amount in such as milk for tea and coffee. It has a coffee machine so nice to be able to have a coffee first thing. There are many places to eat and wander around this area and it was easy enough to get away from the crowds. The staff at the hotel are very welcoming and helpful. There are nice touches such as cake in the foyer and in your room on arrival. We only stayed one night as we were catching the train, it is an easy walk to Gare du Nord.
Unfortunately the roof top bar was closed for a private function so we missed this experience. It was one of the reasons for booking this hotel as we we were only staying one night. The hotel is reasonably expensive.

The hotel is in an excellent location close to the Metro and sights of Montmartre. Breakfast was very good and the staff were very polite and helpful. A drink at the roof-top bar is a must.
Nothing

We could go out to the local bakery for coffee and pastries and go up to the roof top bar to look over the city of Paris while consuming breakfast.we had dinner in the restaurant, great service, food and waiters.
Nothing to mention here

Everything was to our satisfaction. The rooms are small - this is Paris - the bathroom was of good size. Both were very clean, had all amenities and beds were very comfortable. AC worked smoothly and effectively. Location, 5 minutes steep walk to Sacre Coeur along the narrow little alleys of Montmartre is just perfect. We walked downtown Paris twice, 30 minutes and there you are. Bus and metro is also very close. A very well equipped Carrefour supermarket is around the corner. The rooftop terrace is the gem of the hotel - we had free access and lots of tables to choose during our 3 days visit. The view is amazing! 
Everybody who works at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.

The breakfast was good! Fresh orange juice, homemade granola, good ham, sausages and cheese. The scrambled eggs were of good quality but cold. Coffee specialties upon order, rest as buffet.

Staff were very helpful. Lovely views from the rooftop bar. 
Breakfast was fine.
Room was very small and we couldn’t utilise the safe as a bedside cabinet was in front of the wardrobe door. Equally difficult to use the hanging space on that side of the wardrobe.
Very dimly lit interior as you go into the hotel.

Beautiful hotel. Loved the room decor and bathroom, was bigger than I was expecting. Very comfortable. Friendly staff, gorgeous restaurant and rooftop bar.
Felt a little bit far away from some of the things I was interested in but I ended up using the metro to get around and that was pretty easy and straightforward.

Very chic and stylish. The rooms where really big and very clean. The staff where really friendly and helpful. The rooftop bar was especially amazing.
Drinks in the bar can be really expensive.

Location great , room v comfortable , quiet and cool

Nice hotel with chic interior.
Stains on the carpet and small room.

Location- close to metro and 20 min walk from Gare du Nord.. Great views from rooftop. Some good restaurants and a supermarket nearby.

Great funky Hotel 
Friendly staff 
Great location and roof terrace 
Comfortable beds and good size rooms
Nothing

The decor is great - the breakfast quite nice but not great coffee
Coffee and tea wasn’t great - could be nicely served in a tea pot but the fruit salad was great and pastries and preserves too

Fantastic location to great Paris icons we wanted to visit.. easy access to metropolitan!!
Nothing we didn’t like

The breakfast room was very elegant. The buffet choice was good & the staff were very helpful. The views from the rooftop terrace were amazing.

The FOH staff were fantastic, breakfast had a great selection of items (including vegetarian) and wasn't crowded like some hotels, and the view from my room was incredible. I felt welcomed with coffee and madeleines upon arrival, and the bathroom amenities were fabulous. Small rooftop bar with great views and snacks. I'd be happy to come back and stay at Hotel Rochechouart any time!
Limited hotel restaurant menu but plenty of great restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood.

Thé hotel is perfectly situated an easy walk from the Gare du Nord station. The welcome was very friendly and accommodating and we were able to leave our bags safely whilst we explored Paris. In the evening we spent a wonderful time in the trendy rooftop bar enjoying a drink in the sunshine with spectacular views over Paris. The room was spotlessly clean with super soft linen and towels and great smelling toiletries. It was a lovely addition to find a handwritten welcome greeting and a delicious madeleine. All in all, a perfect stay.

Amazing from start to finish. 

The staff make the whole hotel so special!!

The room was amazing. The staff were great, Victor in particular was delightful

Room was nice and big
I have 2 moans 1 the view from the window was not nice metal flues and why was the toilet on one side of room with NO sink to wash hands so then after using toilet you had to go to other end of room to wash your hands in bathroom (the toilet should have a little sink)

Perfect location and beautiful rooftop bar
Everywhere in the hotel was extremely dark

Everything about this hotel leaves you feeling like you're in a romantic Parisian movie set.

The room was beautiful, well fitted and had stunning views of Paris and Montmartre. 
The comfiest bed, yummy snacks, convenient kitchenette, cute bathroom, nice lighting, cupboard space and excellent room service. 

The staff were lovely and super helpful. The breakfast was excellent, and there is a great bar on the roof which has excellent views of Paris. 

The location is also brilliant, with amazing restaurants, cafes, bars and metro stations on your doorstep. 

We absolutely loved our stay and will definitely be back.
Nothing! The breakfast was a bit pricey, but that's Paris for you. 
Quite a noisy neighbourhood with all the construction, but only an issue if you sleep with the window open.

The roof top bar was amazing
Very comfortable room

Location, view and helpful staff
I ordered a champagne which was a surprise to my husband and it was not ready at our arrival

Oh the rooftop bar for sure was superb wonderful panoramic view of Paris!
Also great tapas and breakfast 🥞 X
Erm pretty much no complaints

Location wonderful, view of Sacre Coeur from rooftop bar was fantastic, the beds were sublime and massive bathroom for Paris.
Fan noise in room quite loud.

Great location. Charming interior. Excellent, professional and kind staff

Room, bed, location, helpful and friendly staff, design of the hotel, rooftop bar.
Luggage was left in the wrong room and was a little hard to track it down.

Fabulous roof top bar with incredible views! Lovely staff, comfortable rooms and ensuite!
Rooms are quite small but I guess it’s Paris!

Excellent all round 
Beautifully furnished, quirky, elegant, lovely breakfast, superb staff (so friendly and professional and considerate). Very highly recommend the rooftop bar — what a view!

Incredible views, delicious breakfast, really comfortable bed and chic room.

GOOD LOCATION

Rooms, breakfast were lovely
Service - often waited a long (over an hour) time for ice or an ironing board etc

Our stay here was perfect, the hotel itself is styled beautifully and the staff were very kind and friendly. I think our bed here was the most comfortable one we had on the entire trip, sheets were so soft and lush. Our room was so quiet and relaxing even though we were in a street facing room directly above the restaurant, sound-proofed really well. The hotel is close to a few metro stops and a short walk to many gorgeous patisseries and restaurants throughout Montmartre. The rooftop venue was amazing with a great view of the city, a perfect spot to have a drink before dinner. I really felt like we got great value for our money here and would highly recommend!
The rooms were a bit tight but that's pretty standard for Paris!

Bed was very comfy and we loved the view from our room. A great location and buzzing area with lots of lovely cafes and eateries.

BBC TV channel did not work

Great location and facilities. Good restaurant and rooftop bar.
Check in and check out took a long time. Reception mixed up payment methods and almost charged me double.
Shower gel was very smelly / seemed rotten or; cannot be right. Should have been checked before new guests arrive.

Fantastic location. Great price. Staff very helpful and friendly on reception
Small issue that there was no bright lighting in the rooms to help apply makeup

Location 
Comfortable bed
No robes

Hair in bathroom

No plug by the main mirror in the room

Room was immaculate, a little bit on the small side but it wasn't a problem. The location was perfect. Really easy to get into the centre of Paris, we walked everywhere!
A bit disappointed that we couldn't use the rooftop bar on our first night due to a private party. It was our wedding anniversary to we had been looking forward to that.

the views were very beautiful
The lighting in some rooms was very dark

Good location close to Montmartre. Great staff, very helpful. Really nice roof terrace.
Room was okay, had everything I needed but very small. Also not great to have the hand shower.

Stunning hotel, lovely rooftop, all the staff were lovely and the location is brilliant
The room was a little small, good for a short stay but not for much longer. The breakfast would have been nicer if you could order rather than buffet.

We loved the area of Montmartre. Very buzzy & loads of places to eat & drink. The highlight of our stay was watching the holiday fireworks from the roof terrace.
We were expected to arrive at 3pm and as the train was delayed we arrived at 4pm but our room wasn’t ready until 5.30pm.

Great location
Flexible with room change

Such a great room with the most beautiful large oversized arched French window! Comfortable, the staff was accommodating, breakfast was great and there was a refrigerator and a safe in the room.

Food and location
Small room

Good breakfast! Great location. Super friendly staff.
Room could have used better ventilation.

Comfy beds and a view of Sacre Coeur from our room. Rooftop bar with beautiful views. Warm staff. Nice closet space. Charming historic building. Don't miss the phonograph museum next door--amazing historic devices!
Main surfaces very clean and well kept, but room due for a good dusting in hidden places (closets, corners).

The front desk where amazing from helping with recommendations to making us feel at home.on top of it it was in a great spot
A little bit too dark specially at the front desk

Great location in Montmartre. Beautifully designed interiors with attention to detail. Comfy bed and very, very quiet room with a beautiful view. The rooftop bar has views across Paris and good vibes!

We loved our stay. Super friendly staff, comfortable bed and the rooftop bar was an added bonus.
We would have liked a bit more variety for breakfast. The coffee wasn't good,, but the croissants were great. Apart from that; the breakfast was ok.

Rooftop is the best part!

Great service, very welcoming, professional, efficient, and comfortable stay in a room which had good dimensions and was clean. Lovely welcome note with madelines! Thank you so much. I truly love staying at this hotel. It's been consistently Great!

Lovely staff and excellent food. The highlight is the wonderful roof garden! This is vey popular and there are queues down the street for non residents at the weekend. It’s definitely one of the hotel’s best features. The rooms are lacking storage, but have a lovely style of decoration of the 1920’s era. Great daily chambermaid service. Location is good but can be noisy and busy. All in all a lovely stay.
Need more storage in the rooms.

This hotel is a hidden Parisian gem. In love with its Art Deco interiors, beautifully restored and updated to the expectations of the modern traveler. Both restaurants are amazing, but the roof terrace bar is absolutely unbelievable! Great cocktails and views to die for. You do not find it easily in Paris.
I was initially concerned with the location as Monmartre is not really central. But with both Pigalle and Anvers metro stations in 2 min walk you can reach the very central Paris in 7-10 min while staying in a quieter and nicer neighbourhood.
Nothing, everything was perfect!
My only suggestion - redesign bathrooms to add a shelve/bathroom cabinet, or just install bigger sinks with more surface space. There is no space to put beauty products, I had to move a stool (!) from the room to accommodate mine in the bathroom.

Location good. Rooftop bar great and manager was there was v efficient and friendly. The food ( we had small snacks) was great and lovely non alcoholic cocktails
Too many emails sent to me !
The bathroom was beautifully clean but minute- was almost impossible not to soak bathroom floor when taking a shower.

Great service, extremely nice and helpful.

Great location. Good breakfast.
Room was a little small.

we loved our stay at the hotel! the metro was only a short walk down the road and easily accessible! We loved that we could stroll through Montmartre and experience this side of the city. The highlight for our stay in the hotel was definitely the amazing rooftop bar views! This really made whole experience!!!
nothing!!! everything met my expectation!

The breakfast was delicious! Very clean and staff was friendly.

Most of the staff, particularly Victor were extremely helpful.

The staff! Very helpful. the design of the hotel is also very nice and neat.
very (very-very-very) small room

nice hotel close to sacre Coeur and metro stations . lovely roof top bar and we had room with great view 
staff very helpful and polite
shame cannot use rooftop bar all nights as hired out for private functions. 
be aware in very busy part of Paris and like any city can be noisy all night not criticism just worth noting !

I thought the breakfast wasn’t the best actually compared to our last stay in a hotel in Paris. My husband and I didn’t feel it met expectations in terms of the hot food section-the eggs were not good and very runny. That part could have been a little better. They had a pretty good selection of breads/spreads, but there was not much in terms of yogurt and toppings and/or fruits. I think a better breakfast could have made the hotel a little nicer as this is something that makes a big difference for us. 

The location of hotel was great and we were pleased being where we were so close to our favorite area in Paris & very close to the metro. 

The room was pretty spacious as we know hotel rooms in Europe tend to be small so it was great to have for 4 people in a room. We also loved the view!! The rooftop was a bonus for sure & quite lovely to go up to during the day.
I’d say the only downside was the breakfast & we did have to ask for service multiple times after no one came back to clean our room the first day.

The rooms were pleasantly spacious. We had interconnecting rooms which worked really well as we each had our own private bathrooms. Plenty of storage and comfortable beds.
The capsules for the nespresso machine didn't work which was a shame as it's a really nice thing to have in the room. It may have just been my machine that was faulty.

Great location in Pigalle, rooftop bar with amazing views over all of Paris including Eiffel Tower and Sacre Couer.

The location, the interior of the place and the rooftop for the amazing views. The staff was helpful as well

Great location in Monmartre, very elegant hotel beautifully decorated. Staff were lovely very helpful & the rooftop bar with its views of Paris is exceptional 
Close to the metro
Room was very small with courtyard view which was a bit shabby...Advised by staff that room size in Paris is generally small in comparison to other cities

the style of the hotel, nice restaurant and roof top bar is a bonus
only a small lounge area to have a drink which got busy at peak times so that was frustrating as the restaurant takes up so much of the space.

also our check in was 3pm, but the room was not ready for another hour… until 4pm. considering they charge 50 Euros for an early check in by an hour. we had already hung around an hour to avoid the early charge only to find out it would be late. all we got from staff was a sorry. complimentary bottle of wine would have been nice!

the location was great
close to metro station, walking distance everywhere 
nice restaurants and cafes around 
the hotel had a great rooftop to enjoy

The room was comfortable and the location and rooftop bar were good
There was no desk in the room, the aircon didn't work and I was given a disabled room (the bathroom was a DDA bathroom) and I am not disabled.

rooftop bar with incredible views 
clean and spacious room for 3 guests 
great location - close to metro and some brilliant restaurants nearby too
friendly staff
there is a nightclub open below the restaurant that’s open on Friday and Saturday nights which can be. bit loud if you’re on one of the lower floors and have sensitive hearing. however I am a light sleeper and it didn’t wake me up throughout the night

lovely decor, delicious breakfast, comfortable room although the sink tap was broken.
I asked for an iron 4 times, 3 members of staff said they would find one, one said there wasn’t one & then on the day we left I saw one & an ironing board in the corridor! Its fine but thought I should mention.

loved location and staff were very helpful and pleasant
was little disappointed in roof top was very narrow and small but views were terrific . also there was no electric outlet in bathroom making it awkward to do hair. and shelves in closet way to high and no extra blanket in closet like other hotels I stayed in

Nice hotel in a convenient location! The room was exactly as expected and very clean. Cake and water in the lobby was a nice touch, and the rooftop views are nice at night!

Staff were very welcome and spoke good language
That the public had access to the roof top so guests had to wait to go on roof top.

No price list of mini bar

location
broken elevator. poor view

Great location near Montmarte, nice clean room and bathroom, great staff, very friendly and helpful.
Breakfast is a it expensive so didn't use the restaurant.

location

everything was perfect. the staff were all so friendly and kind, the room was the best room I have ever stayed in with a view of the sacre coeur! we had room service breakfast on my birthday and it was just fantastic!!

The location and roof terrace

Great location, very clean hotel, warm and friendly staff. Nice bathroom
The room as very small - the bathroom was lovely but it was a bit difficult to move around the room due to lack of space around the beds / get into wardrobes. Just another couple of feet at the side of the bed would be great. Having said that the room was lovely and I know rooms are generally quite small in Paris

Very friendly staff and great location to get around Paris. Bed and room very comfortable with great shower pressure. Delicious little cakes on arrival. 
Would recommend !

Great location, well decorated, and lovely staff.

I like the mattress it was super comfy.
The towels wasn't clean left a slight odour. I wish they could provide some bath robes for the guests to use.

well
well

classic, grand and reassuring, fantastic sound insulation and very comfortable large bed. very good shower.
area slightly in between. restaurant not open and breakfast not ready at 7 one morning

close to metro and other facilities. liked the roof terrace
no air conditioning even though our roads was too hot at night. leaving windows open meant a lot of noise

The property is in a fantastic location, our room actually overlooked the Sacre Coure! It was near lots of bars and restaurants, though not at all noisy at night. The hotel’s roof terrace has fantastic views aroun￼d the city. it is also very near to Metro stations so incredibly easy to get around the rest of Paris.

Great location, amazing Haussmann-style building, lovely art deco touches everywhere. Friendly and helpful bilingual staff. Comfortable beds, great in-room amenities, and even my Parisian friend was impressed with the view from the rooftop bar!
We could not figure out how to get the AC working in our room, but this wasn’t a major issue given the time of year fortunately.

strong shower

full_description:
L'hôtel Edouard 7 Opéra vous accueille dans le centre de Paris, à 3 minutes à pied de l'opéra Garnier, à 400 mètres de la place Vendôme et à 500 mètres des Galeries Lafayette.

Toutes les chambres et les suites du Edouard 7 disposent de la climatisation et d'une connexion Wi-Fi haut débit gratuite. Certaines possèdent un balcon privé ou offrent une vue sur l'avenue de l'Opéra. Chaque logement comporte une salle de bains privative pourvue d'une baignoire ou d'une douche, de peignoirs et d'articles de toilette gratuits.

Un petit-déjeuner buffet américain est servi tous les jours moyennant des frais supplémentaires. L'hôtel comprend aussi un bar proposant des cocktails qui sauront satisfaire tous les goûts. Le restaurant "La Cuisine de l'E7" sert une cuisine locale avec des menus bio et de saison.

L'établissement possède un espace d'affaires ainsi qu'une réception ouverte 24h/24 assurant des services de change et de bagagerie. Une salle de sport et des services de concierge/d'étage sont aussi mis à votre disposition. Un parking public est disponible à proximité.

L'hôtel se situe à 5 minutes à pied de la place Vendôme et de boutiques de luxe. Accessible à 200 mètres, la station de métro Opéra dessert des sites touristiques comme le Louvre ou le jardin des Tuileries. Vous pourrez prendre la navette Roissybus place de l'Opéra pour rejoindre l'aéroport international de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle.

Elle est censée venir après 18h30. Au retour de notre soirée elle n’est pas passée. Lits pas fait … le lendemain nous avons fait une sieste en fin d’après-midi. Situation géographique. La gouvernante et le bagagiste étaient agréables et très professionnels.
Salle du petit déjeuner chaleureuse.
A notre arrivée la chambre qu’ils nous proposent ne correspond pas à notre réservation via Booking. En effet au moment de notre installation, nous avons une chambre classique (chambre 706). Ce qui nous interroge : la porte d’entrée de la chambre est située à proximité du lit, la superficie ne correspondait pas au standard chambre de luxe et nous écoutions les bruits des chambres à proximité ainsi que les conversations des personnes circulant au même étage. Après échange avec deux personnes à la réception qui ont eu du mal à reconnaître qu’il y avait une erreur d’attribution, ont fini par nous proposer une chambre correspondante (chambre 211) à notre réservation. (Sans aucune excuses et compensation). Après explication avec une responsable, il nous est même proposé de déménager encore une fois dans une autre chambre disponible plus spacieuse. En résumé, ils ont clairement voulu nous sous classer quant à notre réservation choisie. Ce qui est manifestement du vol. Le prix d’une chambre classique n’étant pas du tout le même tarif que celle de luxe. A retenir la mauvaise fois et le dédain du personnel de la réception lors de nos échanges.

I would like to take a moment to express our gratitude for the wonderful stay we recently had at hotel Edouard 7 in Paris. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by the charming atmosphere and the excellent location—so close to everything we wanted to see and do in the city.
Most importantly, we cannot say enough about the incredibly friendly and attentive staff. Polina, Laurent, and the entire breakfast team went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They truly made our stay special with their warm hospitality and eagerness to help with anything we needed.

We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a delightful and comfortable experience in Paris. We can't wait to return on our next visit!

The service from your staff was impeccable. #1- FIRST the BEST thing about the hotel was RISAL. Every time he saw me, he bent over backwards to offer me the fastest, most excellent and attentive service. One of these occasions was crucial to my enjoyment in Paris. I had tickets for the Philharmonie for 20:00 on Thursday I had reserved 4 months in advance. Because of traffic delays, I had get a taxi. It was 19:00, and I could not get a good one fast! Uber estimated arrival at the hotel at 19.30. RISAL literally ran to the street and got me a taxi and I was able to arrive the concert BEFORE the beginning of the concert! I was very grateful and I offered him my thanks with a very generous pourboire on the last day! #2- The front desk was always attentive, especially those employees who worked at night. #3- The bar employees knew exactly what I wanted to drink when I sat there. One young man, even order the correct Bacardi rum for me so I would have it the next night. #4- I never used the dining room or ate breakfast there, so I cannot provide a review for them. #5- The front desk always provided me with extra coffee packages when it ran out - since I always drank coffee at night. #6- The room was always quiet even on those nights I liked opening the windows. I enjoyed being able to stay out late at night and being able to come in by using the bell. #7- I was provided with a larger luggage holder by the front desk. #8- the Location was phenomenally convenient.
My 7th floor room was unacceptable. #1- The light in the room was so poor that I could NOT see inside the "closet" space against the wall. I was forced to redirect the bed lights towards the wall to see what I had put there. #2- The balcony was not a balcony at all, if I would gotten onto it, I could have fallen to my death. I felt that either the listing for that room was incorrect or you expected me to accept a "balcony" which was really a perch for birds to land. #3- The bathroom did not have handles in the bathtub to hold on to. I am older than most of your guests and I slipped and fell in the bathtub and it took me 20 minutes to lift myself out of it because I could not hold onto something. You really should consider replacing your narrow, slippery and antiquated bathtubs with showers. That would upgrade the quality of your hotel considerably. #4- The cost for this room was not commensurate with the quality I expected. I realized that my room was probably used as servants room in bygone years. That was disappointing, to say the least. I might stay again next year if these important things are resolved to my satisfaction.

The central location, We walked down through the Palais Royale to The Louvre on Saturday evening and on Sunday wandered up through the covered shopping galleries to Montmartre. The hotel is close to Opera Metro station so you can pretty much get anywhere in Paris easily.
We arrived at 3pm and our room wasn't ready which wasn't a big deal. We were told that it would be available in ten minutes and were directed to the bar where we spent 20 euros for a couple of soft drinks - if we were to go back we would just pop out to one of the local cafes before using the hotel bar which is a windowless affair (from my memory) just off reception. Our room once available was fine although the aircon didn't appear to be working. However, the temperature was cool enough in early April so it didn't worry us. We didn't book breakfast as it was much cheaper to eat locally than pay the b&b rate.

From start to finish, the hotel made our trip just perfect. From the moment we arrived outside our bags were taken in for us and taken up to our room. I had messaged the hotel to tell them it was my birthday and they made it so special! I arrived to a bow on my door, there was a turn down service in which the first night they left me a chocolate torte for my birthday (which was delicious and so unexpected!) The beds were really comfortable, the views were amazing and the small window balcony was just the best way to experience our first trip to Paris. A special mention to Laurent who was a fantastic host and a credit to the hotel. He made personal reservations for us at a restaurant and even walked us part of the way there! I could genuinely not have had a better experience, thank you so much! highly recommend!
This is not a criticism as much as it is a note to say it would be better to pre warn visitors about the staff service charge that is added each day. it was around 22 euro per day, we had already chosen to tip some individuals so it was a surprise to have this added to the bill, but we were happy to pay it.

We requested a room for three people and what we got was NOTHING like we saw on Booking! We simply received a double room with King bed and a small portable cot that was jammed in between the bed and window for the third person. It was beyond tight and you couldn’t move around the bed to open the drapes (we had to climb on the bed to reach them every morning). The pictures and description should have been more accurate and we paid considerably more for this room. I spoke with the hotel manager and he told me that I should have specifically asked for the room that I saw on Booking directly with them prior to our visit. There was nothing they could do to because the hotel was full, so we kept the room but felt like we really overpaid for it and had I known, we would have stayed somewhere else. Also, the hotel is older than it appears in the pictures, we had old carpeting with large stains all over which just gave it an unclean feeling. Again, for the room rate, we felt like we overpaid and there are a lot of options in Paris.

#Hotel Edouard VII#
表扬一下此次巴黎住的酒店，Hotel Edouard VII，
 39 AV. de l'Opera, 75002 Paris。位置极佳，在市中心，酒店隔音很好，关上门窗完全听不到街上的声音。左边是歌剧院，900米处是卢浮宫，门口一家马卡龙店，一家总是排长队的甜点店，商店、餐馆、咖啡店都是几步之遥。
酒店服务很好，房间以不同颜色布置，大概看我带绿色行李箱，给我安排了绿色为装饰品的房间。房间里和国内一样啥都有，烧水壶就对中国游客很友好啦[愉快][愉快]要水啊啥的一个电话马上就送上来，每天还发巧克力🍫
下次来的话我还住这儿[呲牙]

Posizione strategica e centrale, ben servita da bus, metro,taxi e in una zona ricca di negozi di ogni genere.
L'albergo corrisponde alla descrizione sia per le camere, che per la pulizia e per le stanze insonorizzate efficacemente.
Personale accogliente e molto attento alle nostre esigenze.
Ogni giorno abbiamo trovato, in camera, per ciascuno di noi un brick da 500ml di acqua con un cioccolatino, gratuiti.
Anche al check out ci hanno offerto dell' acqua da portare con noi.
Ringraziamo Polina, unica alla reception che parla italiano, per la gentilezza e cordialità con cui ci ha fatto sentire a nostro agio.
Lo consigliamo vivamente!!!
Colazione buona anche se poco varia e ripetitiva.

約10年ぶりくらいの2回目の利用でした。前回はクラシックルームでしたが、今回は自分の誕生日で思いきってスーペリアルームバルコニー付きを予約しました。バスタブが付いていて良かったです。
お部屋が清潔で、タオルやスリッパはふかふかして上質で、毎日のチョコレートやお水がありがたく、ポットとコーヒー紅茶も充分に置いてあり、とても快適です。
誕生日に外出から部屋に戻ると、ケーキとメッセージカードがお部屋にあり、心のこもったお気遣いにとても感激しました！！ありがとうございました。
フロントは、ローランさんが日本語で説明してくださり助かりました。毎日どの場面でも、私のつたない英語とフランス語でも、スタッフの皆さん全員とても親切に対応してくださいました。
お部屋のお水は、ペットボトルではなく紙パックで、環境に配慮されていて素晴らしいです。私も環境の配慮に賛同し、シーツの交換はリクエストせずに3泊過ごしました。
唯一、お部屋が寒かったことが残念だったとホテルのアンケートに記載させていただきました。すると、後日、そのことについて丁寧にメールで返信をくださいました。とても誠実で信頼できるホテルだと思いました。
次回もこのホテルを利用したいと思っています。

Desde o primeiro atendimento até o fim da hospedagem, desfrutamos da viagem , com o apoio sempre impecável dos funcionários do Hotel.

本身是舊建築改建成酒店，所以很有法式風情，我自己就非常喜歡。地点又方便，去羅浮宮、歌劇院也是步行距離。其實，去鐵塔雖然要步行一小時，但也值得，因為沿途有很多景點。酒店的職員非常友善，介紹了很多好吃的餐廳，另外，房間我book了三百尺向，所以很豪華和阔落，還给我免費加床。浴室豪華，水壓又夠。暖氣很好。如果你book房的話，一定要連早餐，精緻又好吃，外面吃早餐單一又貴。此外，你book房時可要求房型，他們也肯安排。我們早機到，他們也很快安排我們上房，非常貼心。另外，乘地鐵和巴士也很方便，在酒店楼下便有地鐵站。我個人比較喜歡乘巴士，又可看風景，又不用怕在地鐵迷路。下次再去巴黎，我一定會再選擇入住愛德華七。最後，要鳴謝酒店預備了一個生日蛋糕给我的兒子，非常貼心。
沒有

full_description:
L'Hotel Paris Opéra, Affiliated by Meliá occupe un bâtiment haussmannien du XVIIIe siècle, juste en face de la station de métro Grand Boulevards. Situé à 10 minutes à pied du grand magasin Galeries Lafayette, l’établissement comprend une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite dans l’ensemble de ses locaux ainsi que des hébergements avec une télévision à écran LCD.

Les chambres et les suites de l'Hotel Paris Opéra Affiliated by Meliá sont toutes équipées d'un minibar, d'un coffre-fort privé et d'une télévision connectée à écran plat.

Vous aurez la possibilité de savourer un petit-déjeuner buffet parisien composé de produits frais locaux ainsi que de spécialités françaises et espagnoles.

Vous séjournerez à 26 km de l’aéroport de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle. Sur demande, vous profiterez d’une navette aéroport. La station de métro la plus proche vous permettra de rejoindre directement la place de la Concorde et vous trouverez l’opéra Garnier à 10 minutes à pied.

Occupant un immeuble haussmannien en plein cœur du quartier de Saint-Germain-des-Prés, à seulement 10 minutes à pied du Louvre, le boutique hôtel 5 étoiles Hotel Montalembert propose des chambres dotées de la climatisation, ainsi qu'un bar-restaurant.

Les chambres élégantes de l'Hotel Montalembert affichent des œuvres d'art originales sur les murs. Elles disposent toutes d'une télévision par satellite à écran plat. Leur salle de bains moderne est munie d'articles de toilette gratuits.

Chaque jour, le petit-déjeuner vous sera servi dans la salle prévue à cet effet ou en chambre, sur demande. Le restaurant sur place prépare une cuisine gastronomique innovante. Vous pourrez prendre vos repas ou des boissons sur la terrasse, lorsque le temps le permet.

L'Hotel Montalembert possède une réception ouverte 24h/24 assurant un service de concierge. Une connexion Wi-Fi est également accessible gratuitement dans l'ensemble des locaux de cet établissement non-fumeurs.

La station de métro Rue du Bac, permettant l'accès direct à Montmartre, est accessible à 220 mètres. Enfin, vous pourrez rejoindre à pied le jardin du Luxembourg en 15 minutes, le musée d'Orsay en 7 minutes et le centre commercial Le Bon Marché en 10 minutes.

The location was central to many sites we wanted to visit. Our television did not work the first day and it was replaced after the staff was notified on the second day. The internet was slow, only 2 people could fit in the elevators, 1 person if there was luggage, and while the hotel was spotlessly clean, the entry way was dated. Our suite was beautiful and the view from the 7th floor was breathtaking. The bedding was of great quality and the bed was the best we had as we traveled across Europe. The house keeping staff were excellent at their craft, as were the front desk staff. There was an African American gentleman whonwent above and beyind to share information about restaurants and their menu and the manager called several restaurants to determine their menu. We were very pleased with our stay.
At the price point we paid, everything in the room should have worked with precision.l prior to our arrival. The towel warmer was not functional and television did not work until it was replaced the following day. The carpet was shedding in the bedroom area. Despite our compromises, we were charged for the use of the mini bar even though we were not told there was a charge for it's use.

The location, rooms and staff were all amazing. Great service and everyone made us feel right at home during our stay.

The Montalembert is brilliantly located to explore attraction and shops on the rive gauche as well as museums on the other side. Staff is very helpful with parking, bags, shopping, restaurant suggestions and bookings. The hotel is charming with rooms on the small side (but it’s Paris after all;-) and well equipped. We had a lovely view over the roofs of Paris to the garden courtyard of SciencePo which was a treat (a converted cloister). The chimes of the next door church - at 9:00am very civilised - were magical.
Breakfast is a bit so so and better coffee from a proper machine would be a huge improvement.

It's a well-wrought hotel with effortless left bank style. The staff is warm, welcoming and very helpful. The hotel I normally stay at was fully booked, so I tried Hotel Montalembert for a change and felt it was money well-spent.
The only thing I'm not keen on is its location. The location is very convenient for sight-seeing (Musee d'Orsay, Musee Rodin, Louvre etc), if one is unfamiliar with Paris, and visiting the sights high on one's agenda. There is also a grocery store right across from the hotel. While it does offer this level of convenience, this location (from my pov) is sterile and less residential than what I personally prefer. it lacks the charm and energy of the Saint Germain I know.

full_description:
Idéalement situé dans le centre de Paris, le Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel propose des hébergements climatisés, une salle de sport, une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite et une terrasse. Cet hôtel 5 étoiles comporte un bar. Vous profiterez également d’un centre d’affaires ainsi que de services d’étage et de change.

Les chambres de l’hôtel comportent un bureau, une télévision à écran plat et une salle de bains privative. Les serviettes de toilette et le linge de lit sont fournis. Chaque hébergement est équipé d'un coffre-fort. Certains sont équipés d'un balcon et d'autres offrent une vue sur la ville. Toutes les chambres sont munies d’une armoire.

Un petit-déjeuner buffet, continental ou américain est proposé chaque matin. Le Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel possède un restaurant servant une cuisine méditerranéenne. Des plats végétariens, végétaliens et sans gluten sont également préparés sur demande.

Le personnel de la réception ouverte 24h/24 parle allemand, anglais, arabe et espagnol.

L'arc de Triomphe se trouve à 700 mètres, tandis que le Palais des Congrès de Paris vous attend à 1,7 km de l’établissement. L’aéroport de Paris-Orly est situé à 23 km.

C’est mon hôtel préféré de par sa localisation et l’offre de restauration à quelques pas. Aussi, tout est près et plusieurs attractions se font à pieds, dont l’Arc de Triomphe, l’avenue des Champs Élysée, la place de la Concorde, le jardin des Tuileries, le musée du Louvre et la Tour Eiffel est à 15 minutes à pieds. Location is great - 300 meters from the Arc of Triumph and walking distance to two Metro station and RER station, which makes it very convenient to travel to different part of Paris. Room is big and the bed is very comfortable. The staff are very friendly and they refill the supplements very frequently - water, tower, hotel slippers and etc. During my stay, I never worry about being lack of these. The breakfast is also good - wide variety and good quality.
The only setback for this hotel is its elevator - the hotel has more than 7 floors and there are only two elevators for both staff and guest, the pain part is that one out of two is under decoration/maintainance so there's only one elevator available for both guest and staff. Consequently, during some peak traffic time like breakfast and checkout, we have to wait long time to get into the elevator since sometimes it's full. Although it's a bit not acceptable but I would say this is understandable, the hotel locates in center Paris and the buildings here have limited allowance to do reconstruction/redecoration.

As my previous point states we were there for a birthday gift for my husband - the staff member who booked us in did not think to ask who had paid for the trip and would it be ok to disclose prices, and automatically assumed my husband had and told him what I was paying for his birthday present.....this then turned into an uncomfortable exchange between my hsuband and I on how much I'd spent on a hotel for 3 nights!

We stayed at this hotel when it first opened. It was amazing, clean, comfortable and well trained professional staff. However, everything went downhill in recent years. This time, when we entered the lobby of the hotel, it already felt dated, only one lift is working, corridor is dark, carpet looks faded and the overall place felt kooky and shabby, especially in the corridors leading to our rooms. When we entered our hotel room, we saw fingerprints and the minibar fridge. The room has an extremely pungeant smell to it as well as it being unclean (after removing the bottles of drinks in the fridge, we found the bottom of the fridge is sticky and with many stains.When we first came to Renaissance many years ago, the amenities for theirs guests were a luxury brand , yet the soaps/shampoos that were now provided are unknown brands. the daily clean was careless, the sink has visible stain but has not been wiped off…. The room interior like everywhere else in the hotel is dated, worn out… this is all relative to 5-star-hotel standard, what we are experiencing is barely 4 star. Not worth the room rates at all.

full_description:
Doté d'une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite et d'un bistro-restaurant, l'établissement Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain & Spa vous propose des hébergements à Paris, à seulement 500 mètres de Saint-Germain-des-Prés. Vous pourrez savourer, près de la cheminée en pierre du salon, une boisson ou un verre de vin commandés au bar sur place.

Décorées dans des tons chauds, toutes les chambres du Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain & Spa sont équipées d'une télévision à écran plat et d'une bouilloire électrique, ainsi que de chaussons et d'articles de toilette gratuits. Certaines chambres possèdent un coin salon.

Le petit-déjeuner est servi tous les matins moyennant des frais supplémentaires. Vous pourrez le déguster dans le confort de votre chambre, sur demande auprès de la réception ouverte 24h/24.

Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain & Spa se tient à 600 mètres du musée d'Orsay et à 700 mètres du musée du Louvre. L'aéroport de Paris-Orly, le plus proche, est quant à lui distant de 14 km.

The staff was incredible and the hotel was dreamy! It was on a quiet but central street and it was the most picturesque decor. We went around Christmas time so it was quite magical and smelled of fresh pine in the lobby. The upgraded our room when we checked in and we had the most amazing suite!! It was definitely larger than our US sized master bedroom and had two bathrooms!! What a treat. 
Annette checked us in and she was amazing/so friendly. We were able to walk to some of the liveliest locations in Saint Germain but if we didn't want to do that we typically hopped on the e-bikes right out front and rode them around the city-which I highly recommend. 
The bar and cocktails were delicious and it was quite the vibe. Loved hanging out there.
The spa was also incredible: only and very minor complaint was that we were hoping the pool was more of jacuzzi temperature but non-issue-just preference. Thank you for a dream vacation!

Ebenso musste ich um das Spa zu erreichen, den Aufzug nehmen, der neben der Küche angrenzend an das Restaurant war und die das Restaurant und die gante Lobby im Bademantel durchqueren. Es gibt sicherlich bessere Zimmer, meins war jedenfalls unerträglich

Veel te duur voor een klein basis kamer met haast niks luxe erin. Douche was met douche gordijn en ventilator die veel herrie maakte. Oud tv in kamer . Bed was met 2 matrassen waardoor wij in het midden erg oncomfortabel lagen. Alles viel super tegen en heb spijt dat ik daar zo veel geld voor heb betaald. Je betaald meer voor de locatie wat al super duur is. Ontbijt was erg matig. Zowat geen keuzes en brood was minimaal. Algeheel had ik van 5 sterren hotel meer verwacht vergeleken met ons hele trip in 5 sterren hadden geslapen. Teleurstellend en baalde super van mijn boeking. Weggegooid geld.

full_description:
Le Melia Paris Champs Elysées vous accueille à proximité des Champs-Élysées et de la tour Eiffel. Vous pourrez aisément rejoindre le quartier de La Défense et le palais des congrès de la Porte Maillot. Vous profiterez d'une connexion Internet gratuite dans l'ensemble de cet hôtel entièrement non-fumeurs.

Toutes les chambres du Melia Paris Champs Elysées disposent d'une salle de bains privative, de la climatisation et d'une bouilloire électrique. Elles sont aussi dotées d'une ligne de téléphone directe et de la télévision par satellite.

Le matin, vous pourrez savourer un petit-déjeuner buffet au restaurant ou dans votre chambre. De midi à 22h30, un service d'étage est assuré par un restaurant réputé situé place Victor Hugo.

Bénéficiant d'un emplacement idéal pour visiter les sites d'intérêt de la capitale, le Melia Paris Champs Elysées se trouve à 2 minutes à pied de la station de métro Victor Hugo (sur la ligne 2) et du Trocadéro.

Accueil et personnel sympathiques. Bonne localisation. Etablissement présentant bien, belles chambres et finitions. Literie conforable et très bonne propreté d'ensemble.
L'isolation phonique était déplorable. Fenêtres (à double vitrage) fermées, on sentait l'air passer et on entendait nettement le bruit de la rue alors que la chambre donnait sur l'arrière. On entendait les voisins discuter comme si nous étions dans la même chambre. Tous les bruits de couloirs passaient. 
Le petit déjeuner était de qualité médiocre, tout juste du niveau d'un Ibis. Les baguettes étaient clairement industrielles et décongelées. Les autres produits étaient de même facture. Fade et parfaitement standardisées.

El hotel está muy bien ubicado, es limpio, el personal es atento y muy amable. Todo muy bien. Lo que mas me gustó fue que los productos de baño eran de Rituals.

Und hat wie in den zwei Aufenthalten zuvor zunächst die sehr gute Lage, die unmittelbare Nähe des Parkhauses zum Hotel und die Ruhe veranlasst wieder hier zu übernachten.
Uns gefällt die Architektur des Gebäude sehr und die erkennbare teils leichte Morbidität zB der Fenster stört uns nicht, da wir privat auch ein Denkmal bewohnen.
Bewusst haben wir nun eine bessere Kategorie gewählt, um ein größeres Zimmer zu erhalten. Das hat sich ausgezahlt. Es war alles sehr sauber und ordentlich. Das Personal am Empfang war sehr freundlich - einzig des nachts kann es auch anders sein. 
In den letzten Jahren sind die Zimmerpreise drastisch gestiegen - wohl nicht nur hier.
Der Zimmertresor ist am Samstag Abend nicht vom Personal zu öffnen. Das könnte zu Problemen führen.

Die sehr gute Lage läßt uns immer gerne wiederkommen. Das kleine aber feine Hotel in einem Haussmann Gebäude gelegen mit dem typischen Fahrstuhl im Treppenhaus übt auf uns seinen besonderen Reiz aus. Der Ausblick auf die Straße gefiel.
Dieses Mal war das Zimmer derart klein, dass man fast nach dem Öffnen der Tür ins Bett stolperte. Das sehr geschmackvolle Bad war so eng, dass man auch allein darin sich kaum bewegen konnte.
Beim nächsten Besuch nehmen wir ein größeres Zimmer (andere Kategorie).

full_description:
Situé au cœur de Saint-Germain-des-Prés, l'Hôtel Bel Ami propose une salle de sport et un sauna, à 10 minutes à pied du musée du Louvre.

Les chambres comprennent une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, un minibar et une télévision à écran plat. Certaines offrent une vue sur Saint-Germain-des-Prés.

Chaque matin, un petit déjeuner buffet est servi au café de l'hôtel qui s'ouvre sur la rue Saint Benoit. Vous pourrez vous détendre avec un cocktail au bar du Bel Ami, qui prépare également une sélection de collations légères et de pâtisseries.

L'Hôtel Bel Ami se trouve à 140 mètres de la station de métro Saint-Germain-des-Prés. La cathédrale Notre-Dame et le quartier latin de Paris sont à seulement 15 minutes à pied.

Room service was a disaster. 
When ever we ordered food each time they serviced it wrong. 
We ordered 2 coke zero, ice, 1 plain penne, 1 penne with sauce, water, soda.
They called us two times to check the order. Then what happened. 
They brought normal coke rather than zero, both pasta with sauce, no bottle opener to open the bottles. 
When we called room service for bottle opener they told us “they can’t leave bottle opener in the room because customers steal them. So first of all how rude attitude is this to us??? You call your customer as a potential thief. If you have such kind of a problem then charge the bottle opener from the deposit wich you take for the first night.
If we don’t have a bottle opener how are we going to drink the things in bottles???

Then room service came to room with opener and told us “open all of them at the same time” 😂 so coke, water, perrier at the same time. If you don’t mind I want to decide on the timing of drinks I want to consume.

And also the other biggest problem “room service doesn’t speak enough level of English” come on how come? You are a 5 star hotel.

We ordered 2 earl grey tea and a big pot of hot water. They brought us two “big” pots with hot water, which is ok. But they already put the tea bags in the pots. “One per each”. First biggest problem each pot has around 800-900 ml water, so each bag is for around 200ml water. 
So what is the logic behind this, tell me???

We drank a yellow hot water but it was not earl grey because it can’t be earl grey due to amount of water. 
I felt that we stayed in a 3th class, poor quality hostel. 

Jus to underline one thing; all of the staff had good manners and they were all respectful. No question about it. But this room service experience was the worst we have had so far. Hope you reassess your room service quality and very sensitive bottle opener approach for your future customers as we won’t be amongst them. There are 1.500 hotels in Paris.

full_description:
Situé à Paris, dans le 16ème arrondissement, à proximité de la tour Eiffel et du Trocadéro, l’établissement 5 étoiles de style parisien Brach Paris - Evok Collection propose une salle de sport avec des piscines, un sauna, un hammam et des salles de massage, ainsi qu’un salon de coiffure. Vous profiterez de cours collectifs de sport gratuits, ainsi que d’un service d’entraîneur privé moyennant des frais supplémentaires.

Lumineuses et spacieuses, les chambres et les suites sont entièrement équipées et insonorisées. Elles comprennent une chaîne hi-fi haut de gamme, des articles de toilette personnalisés, une literie de qualité, un dressing et un élégant bureau. Certaines chambres et suites s’ouvrent sur une terrasse et offrent une vue sur Paris et les façades haussmanniennes.

Un petit-déjeuner est servi chaque matin sur place. Ouvert 7j/7 toute la journée, le restaurant du Brach Paris - Evok Collection prépare des plats équilibrés et inspirés de la cuisine méditerranéenne à la carte. Vous pourrez également déguster des pâtisseries créées par Yann Brys, Meilleur Ouvrier de France, ainsi que des cocktails en fin de soirée.

La réception ouverte 24h/24 et 7j/7, avec sa grande terrasse, vous attend au 1er étage. L’établissement assure des services de limousine privée et de voiturier. Le service de conciergerie se fera un plaisir de vous organiser une variété de services dans tout Paris. Un centre d'affaires et un service d'étage assuré 24h/24 sont également à votre disposition.

L'aéroport de Paris-Orly, le plus proche, est situé à 21 km de l’hôtel. L’aéroport de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle se trouve à 30 km de l’établissement.

Décoration au top et roof top tout à fait unique !

Une experience incroyable. Une soirée de rêve.
Tout est parfait, du repas, à la chambre en passant par les attentions du personnel. Parfait est le mot!!!

Tout étais parfait, la deco de lachambre et les matériaux utilisés sont exceptionnels , le service et l’accueil sont irréprochables. Le staff est très accueillant.
La seule chose qui peut être relevée c’est l’odeur du parfum d’ambiance qui est diffusé à la réception! En sortant de l’ascenseur cette odeur nous prend désagréablement!

Le Brach propose des chambres vraiment originales. L'hôtel est calme, loin du tumulte parisien alors qu'il est situé à Paris !
Les installations sont du standing d'un cinq étoiles.
Manque de personnel avec un savoir être cinq étoiles. 
Orienté service client oui, le sourire est là, l'envie d'être pro également, et puis il y a le collègue qui passe et on se salue à l'américaine "wesh frère, ça va...?"... ça fait sourire, et puis des choses simples semblent compliquées, il faut s'assurer d'avoir l'autorisation etc... par exemple demander une bière à minuit un dimanche relève presque de l'exploit, on ne sait pas si c'est le barman qui doit intervenir ou le room service. Grande question. La bière arrive finalement. :-) De mon point de vue simpliste de client, ladite bière on va la chercher dans le frigo et on laisse une note aux collègues pour lui dire que l'on en a sorti une pour qu'il régularise ses stocks.
Et cette bière on la dégusterait bien sur l'un des plus beau roof top de la capitale, qui est un atout commercial de l'hôtel,... ben non... il n'est accessible qu'à certaines heures de la journée. Difficile de comprendre que les restaurants et bar de l'hôtel soient fermés un dimanche d'août, période creuse pour les parisiens, mais période pleine pour le tourisme parisien. Cependant, je pense que c'est le monde de l'hôtellerie restauration post-covid dans son ensemble qui doit être en difficulté de recrutement de personnel, le Brach fait avec. Je maintiens que c'est un excellent hôtel où j'ai passé une nuit inoubliable, literie exceptionnelle... Bref, "Frères, allez-y le Brach ça arrache !" :-)

Tout du resto à la piscine

Exquisite hotel - beautifully designed, buzzing and with a distinct character. The neighborhood (16th arrondissement) is very nice - quiet and residential yet chic, with most key attractions within a reasonable 15-20 min taxi ride. Great toiletries, minibar, room amenities.

The Evok Conciergerie team is absolutely fantastic - extremely responsive and helped me arrange a smooth and enjoyable itinerary - did not have to worry about a single reservation as all the restaurants I wanted to visit had been booked well in advance per my request, and all requests to reschedule/rearrange were addressed in a prompt and friendly manner. Hotel staff were wonderful and helpful too!
The rooms are rather small (even the Superior category) - probably par for the course for Paris, so not really a downside - more of an aspect to be aware of (was pretty tricky to open up a large suitcase in the room…). Also was a bit difficult to figure out the various switches for the lighting in the room.

Breakfast options in the hotel restaurant are nice, but can be quite pricey (especially when opting for à la carte) - would be nice to have breakfast included at this price point for the rooms.

full_description:
L'établissement La Clef Louvre Paris by The Crest Collection est situé dans le centre-ville de Paris, en face de la Comédie-Française, à 500 mètres du musée du Louvre et du Jardin des Tuileries. Il propose des suites modernes climatisées avec kitchenette entièrement équipée.

Les suites bénéficient d'une connexion Internet gratuite, d'une télévision par satellite et d'un plateau/bouilloire. Le petit-déjeuner buffet, servi tous les matins dans le salon commun, se compose de produits frais locaux.

L'établissement La Clef Louvre Paris by The Crest Collection possède une salle de sport ainsi qu'une réception ouverte 24h/24 assurant des services de blanchisserie et de nettoyage à sec. Vous pourrez vous détendre dans le salon équipé d'une télévision à écran LCD, d'un ordinateur avec imprimante et d'une connexion Internet gratuite.

La Clef Louvre Paris by The Crest Collection se trouve à 100 mètres de la rue Saint-Honoré et à 800 mètres de l'Opéra. La station de métro Palais Royal - Musée du Louvre, permettant un accès direct à la Bastille et La Défense, se situe à 140 mètres.

Le Nolinski Paris - Evok Collection est situé dans le 1er arrondissement de Paris, à 500 mètres du jardin des Tuileries et à proximité du quartier commerçant de la rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré. Cet hôtel 5 étoiles parisien propose un spa avec une piscine, un sauna, un hammam et des salles de massage. et où vous pourrez apprécier des produits de beauté La Colline.

Spacieuses et lumineuses, les chambres et suites de l’hôtel sont dotées de rideaux somptueux, de tapis moelleux, d’une literie de qualité, de grandes armoires et d’un bureau élégant. Des peignoirs et des chaussons sont fournis pour davantage de confort. Certaines chambres possèdent des fenêtres et un balcon donnant sur le cœur de Paris.

Au Nolinski Le Restaurant, vous pourrez déguster des plats créés par le chef exécutif de l'hôtel, Philip Chronopoulos, dans un décor signé par le designer anglais John Whelan, qui a mêlé le style Art déco avec l’esprit des années 1970.

Au Grand Salon, vous pourrez vous détendre avec une tasse de thé, goûter des plats méditerranéens au déjeuner et au dîner, ou déguster un cocktail en fin de soirée. Vous aurez également la possibilité de déjeuner ou de dîner au restaurant gastronomique Palais Royal récompensé de 2 étoiles au guide Michelin, situé à proximité de l’établissement.

Le personnel de la réception du Nolinski Paris - Evok Collection est disponible 24h/24 et 7j/7. L’hôtel se trouve à moins de 1 km du musée du Louvre et de l’opéra Garnier. L’aéroport de Paris-Orly, le plus proche, est accessible à 15 km du Nolinski Paris - Evok Collection.

There was no kettle and coffee machine in the room. They were delivered to my room promptly after my request, plus a large bowl filled with many capsules! I was also offered extra bottles of water - I guess it was because I once mentioned to the staff (who showed me to the room upon check in) that I drink a lot of water! Very attentive and good service.

Lovely unique rooms in a perfect location near the Louvre.

loved the location, the interior and look of the hotel. amazing works of art everywhere and the scent in the hotel sets you for a nice all senses luxury experience. loved how luxurious everything was. loved the comfort of the room, nice and spacious, could turn off the aircon because it was warm enough, loved that I could open the window to the little balcony and look at the view outside overlooking Opera, staff were wonderful and helpful. got 1.5 hr late check out.
the food. the pot coffee was not good, my eggs came cold, salad was not fresh, however they took them off my bill. so still managed to make me happy.

stylish. centrally located. beautiful.

The Nolinski is one of the most outstanding hotels we have ever been, and it definetly wasn't the first "better hotel" we have visited. Every single aspect was just amazing. We had high expectations based on the price and they managed to exceed it. The room: Superb, with an amazingly comfy bed and a small balcony with a view to the opera. The hotel is between the opera and the louvre, and while I did not even realize that when booking, it was amazing. On the question where we could east out "well" close by the answer was "everywhere around" and damn that was correct. In the same street you will find one of the best sweet bakeries in the world, around the corner the pyramides bistro is the perfect location for a quick soupe l'oignon and the metro pyramides is literally right in front of the hotel. While the space in the spa is tiny and more meant for a "i go to the spa, and then to the room" situation, swimming in the mirror ceiled pool after a short warming up in the sauna was just the best thing in the moment ever - after a cold and rainy day in januaryr. The cocktails in the bar were amazing and when we on the last evening only had 30 minutes before we needed to leave the bar keeper had not yet opened the bar - he still tried his best to serve the best sazerac and old fashioned we have drunk in quite some time, and that is our basic cocktail.

All in all, this was a special trip for us and the Nolinski staff made it to the best they could. I could not have asked for a single thing more. Thank you for going the extra mile on every single request we had, including the amazing service at our lunch and while we did not catch the name of the staff at the breakfast: Thank you, you made every single start of the day as good as it could have been,

This was one of the best trips we ever had and you were part of making it that great!
Let's face it, there are really only two things you could not like, one is the tiny rest space in the spa and the second is the price. For us and this was a special trip we could not have asked for more, but your mileage might vary.

most of the staff especially the front desk and concierge were very helpful and friendly. there were just a couple hiccups with the restaurant staff. ordered something for breakfast and when the lady server delivered the wrong thing and i corrected her, instead of simply apologizing she rolled her eyes and left and didnt even come back. Another person brought in the right order. Very rude and unprofessional. Also, once with housekeeping. They wanted to clean the room and I told them to come back in an hour or so. When they did and I wasn't ready, she sounded irritated. I think they should recognize that guests are on vacation and need not be held to a strict timeline. Didn't expect such response from a five star hotel.

Price, service. The stay was prepaid, but upon arrival the hotel asked for 1200 € as deposit. We stayed there for 3 nights in 2 rooms. We were surprised by the amount and asked about it, they said they charge 200 € deposit / night / room. After paying 4000 € for the stay, asking for additional 1200 is excessive. But we paid it. What made us upset after that was to find our rooms not cleaned at 5 pm. We left the hotel at 9 am, returned at 5 pm and the cleaning staff was by our door. We had to get ready for an event, so we couldn't wait for them to clean. Which is not the end of the world but after paying so much money, paying the deposit, it was disappointing. Even in 4star hotels they magage to clean our rooms in time.

I asked for a quiet room but as I was on the 1st floor, could hear the metro underneath. Also, the pool temperature was too cold and the restaurant was just ok. Breakfast wasn’t included in my rate and the one morning we ate there, my poached eggs arrived freezing cold. I sent them back but received no reduction in the cost of my breakfast. Also, the hotel does not have any outdoor space and it’s concierge service was outsourced to a third party and not helpful. I would not stay here again for almost $900 per night- excluding breakfast!

My Montblanc writing pen (I always have in my business bag for many, many years) is missing since then as well. I don’t seem to be the first one who had this experience at Nolinski (see other reviews).

full_description:
Overlooking Paris's oldest planned square, the Place des Vosges, the Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection offers upscale accommodation in the Marais district, 450 metres from Place de la Bastille. The hotel boasts facilities such as a Roman Bath, in-room massages and a personal trainer.

Each room at the Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection has a private bathroom complete with bathrobes, slippers and toiletries. There is also a flat-screen TV, a streaming service and a minibar. Some rooms feature a kitchenette.

An à la carte breakfast is served each morning at the Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection, and guests can also enjoy breakfast from the comfort of their room. Guests can dine in the hotel's restaurant and there is a 24-hour front desk.

Pompidou Centre is 1.7 km from the hotel, while Sainte-Chapelle is 1.8 km from the property. The nearest airport is Paris - Orly Airport, 16 km from Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection.

full_description:
This design hotel is situated in the centre of Paris, just a 10-minute walk from the Louvre. Guests can relax in the indoor swimming pool with natural daylight, or visit the sauna with a steam room and multi-jet shower. A well-equipped fitness room is also available to guests.

The air-conditioned rooms and suites at Renaissance Paris Vendome feature a flat-screen TV, safe. Each room has a marble bathroom with bathrobes, slippers and Tokyo Milk complimentary wellness products.

The Renaissance Paris Vendome Hotel regularly organises temporary art exhibitions and concerts in the lobby to introduce you to the neighborhood.

The hotel is 110 metres from the Jardin de Tuileries and its iconic Ferris Wheel. Tuileries Metro Station is just 180 metres from the hotel, providing direct access to the Champs-Elysées.

full_description:
L'Hôtel De Sers vous accueille dans un manoir du XIXe siècle, situé à seulement 400 mètres de l'avenue des Champs-Élysées. Il vous propose une cour, une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, un sauna ainsi qu'un hammam.

Climatisées et insonorisées, toutes les chambres disposent d'une télévision à écran plat et d'un lecteur DVD/CD. Chacune d'elles comprend également des équipements de qualité tels qu'une salle de bains en marbre ou du mobilier en bois de rose. La plupart des suites offrent une vue superbe sur la capitale.

Le restaurant de l'hôtel se situe au bout de la galerie de portraits de l'hôtel et donne sur une cour arborée. Vous pourrez dîner dans sa salle à manger pourvue d'un décor en marbre ou sur la terrasse en été. Paré de boiseries et d'un comptoir en marbre, le S'Ba sert un grand choix de cocktails.

L'Hôtel De Sers se trouve à 5 minutes à pied des stations de métro George V et Alma - Marceau, qui vous permettront de rejoindre tous les sites célèbres de Paris. Sur réservation préalable, des massages et des transferts aéroport peuvent être organisés.
